content: 1 The proverbs of Solomon son of David, king of Israel:
content_old: 1 The proverbs of Solomon son of David, king of Israel:

content: 2 For learning wisdom and discipline; For understanding words of discernment;
content_old: 2 For learning wisdom and discipline; For understanding words of discernment;

content: 3 For acquiring the discipline for success, Righteousness, justice, and equity;
content_old: 3 For acquiring the discipline for success, Righteousness, justice, and equity;

content: 4 For endowing the simple with shrewdness, The young with knowledge and foresight.
content_old: 4 For endowing the simple with shrewdness, The young with knowledge and foresight.

content: 5 —The wise man, hearing them, will gain more wisdom; The discerning man will learn to be adroit;
content_old: 5 —The wise man, hearing them, will gain more wisdom; The discerning man will learn to be adroit;

content: 6 For understanding proverb and epigram, The words of the wise and their riddles.
content_old: 6 For understanding proverb and epigram, The words of the wise and their riddles.

content: 7 The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge; Fools despise wisdom and discipline.
content_old: 7 The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge; Fools despise wisdom and discipline.

content: 8 My son, heed the discipline of your father, And do not forsake the instruction of your mother;
content_old: 8 My son, heed the discipline of your father, And do not forsake the instruction of your mother;

content: 9 For they are a graceful wreath upon your head, A necklace about your throat.
content_old: 9 For they are a graceful wreath upon your head, A necklace about your throat.

content: 10 My son, if sinners entice you, do not yield;
content_old: 10 My son, if sinners entice you, do not yield;

content: 11 If they say, “Come with us, Let us set an ambush to shed blood, Let us lie in wait for the innocent
content_old: 11 If they say, “Come with us, Let us set an ambush to shed blood, Let us lie in wait for the innocent

content: 12 Like Sheol, let us swallow them alive; Whole, like those who go down into the Pit.
content_old: 12 Like Sheol, let us swallow them alive; Whole, like those who go down into the Pit.

content: 13 We shall obtain every precious treasure; We shall fill our homes with loot.
content_old: 13 We shall obtain every precious treasure; We shall fill our homes with loot.

content: 14 Throw in your lot with us; We shall all have a common purse.”
content_old: 14 Throw in your lot with us; We shall all have a common purse.”

content: 15 My son, do not set out with them; Keep your feet from their path.
content_old: 15 My son, do not set out with them; Keep your feet from their path.

content: 16 For their feet run to evil; They hurry to shed blood.
content_old: 16 For their feet run to evil; They hurry to shed blood.

content: 17 In the eyes of every winged creature The outspread net means nothing.
content_old: 17 In the eyes of every winged creature The outspread net means nothing.

content: 18 But they lie in ambush for their own blood; They lie in wait for their own lives.
content_old: 18 But they lie in ambush for their own blood; They lie in wait for their own lives.

content: 19 Such is the fate of all who pursue unjust gain; It takes the life of its possessor.
content_old: 19 Such is the fate of all who pursue unjust gain; It takes the life of its possessor.

content: 20 Wisdom cries aloud in the streets, Raises her voice in the squares.
content_old: 20 Wisdom cries aloud in the streets, Raises her voice in the squares.

content: 21 At the head of the busy streets she calls; At the entrance of the gates, in the city, she speaks out:
content_old: 21 At the head of the busy streets she calls; At the entrance of the gates, in the city, she speaks out:

content: 22 “How long will you simple ones love simplicity, You scoffers be eager to scoff, You dullards hate knowledge?
content_old: 22 “How long will you simple ones love simplicity, You scoffers be eager to scoff, You dullards hate knowledge?

content: 23 You are indifferent to my rebuke; I will now speak my mind to you, And let you know my thoughts.
content_old: 23 You are indifferent to my rebuke; I will now speak my mind to you, And let you know my thoughts.

content: 24 Since you refused me when I called, And paid no heed when I extended my hand,
content_old: 24 Since you refused me when I called, And paid no heed when I extended my hand,

content: 25 You spurned all my advice, And would not hear my rebuke,
content_old: 25 You spurned all my advice, And would not hear my rebuke,

content: 26 I will laugh at your calamity, And mock when terror comes upon you,
content_old: 26 I will laugh at your calamity, And mock when terror comes upon you,

content: 27 When terror comes like a disaster, And calamity arrives like a whirlwind, When trouble and distress come upon you.
content_old: 27 When terror comes like a disaster, And calamity arrives like a whirlwind, When trouble and distress come upon you.

content: 28 Then they shall call me but I will not answer; They shall seek me but not find me.
content_old: 28 Then they shall call me but I will not answer; They shall seek me but not find me.

content: 29 Because they hated knowledge, And did not choose fear of the LORD;
content_old: 29 Because they hated knowledge, And did not choose fear of the LORD;

content: 30 They refused my advice, And disdained all my rebukes,
content_old: 30 They refused my advice, And disdained all my rebukes,

content: 31 They shall eat the fruit of their ways, And have their fill of their own counsels.
content_old: 31 They shall eat the fruit of their ways, And have their fill of their own counsels.

content: 32 The tranquillity of the simple will kill them, And the complacency of dullards will destroy them.
content_old: 32 The tranquillity of the simple will kill them, And the complacency of dullards will destroy them.

content: 1 My son, if you accept my words And treasure up my commandments;
content_old: 1 My son, if you accept my words And treasure up my commandments;

content: 2 If you make your ear attentive to wisdom And your mind open to discernment;
content_old: 2 If you make your ear attentive to wisdom And your mind open to discernment;

content: 3 If you call to understanding And cry aloud to discernment,
content_old: 3 If you call to understanding And cry aloud to discernment,

content: 4 If you seek it as you do silver And search for it as for treasures,
content_old: 4 If you seek it as you do silver And search for it as for treasures,

content: 5 Then you will understand the fear of the LORD And attain knowledge of God.
content_old: 5 Then you will understand the fear of the LORD And attain knowledge of God.

content: 6 For the LORD grants wisdom; Knowledge and discernment are by His decree.
content_old: 6 For the LORD grants wisdom; Knowledge and discernment are by His decree.

content: 7 He reserves ability for the upright And is a shield for those who live blamelessly,
content_old: 7 He reserves ability for the upright And is a shield for those who live blamelessly,

content: 8 Guarding the paths of justice, Protecting the way of those loyal to Him.
content_old: 8 Guarding the paths of justice, Protecting the way of those loyal to Him.

content: 9 You will then understand what is right, just, And equitable—every good course.
content_old: 9 You will then understand what is right, just, And equitable—every good course.

content: 10 For wisdom will enter your mind And knowledge will delight you.
content_old: 10 For wisdom will enter your mind And knowledge will delight you.

content: 11 Foresight will protect you, And discernment will guard you.
content_old: 11 Foresight will protect you, And discernment will guard you.

content: 12 It will save you from the way of evil men, From men who speak duplicity,
content_old: 12 It will save you from the way of evil men, From men who speak duplicity,

content: 13 Who leave the paths of rectitude To follow the ways of darkness,
content_old: 13 Who leave the paths of rectitude To follow the ways of darkness,

content: 14 Who rejoice in doing evil And exult in the duplicity of evil men,
content_old: 14 Who rejoice in doing evil And exult in the duplicity of evil men,

content: 15 Men whose paths are crooked And who are devious in their course.
content_old: 15 Men whose paths are crooked And who are devious in their course.

content: 16 It will save you from the forbidden woman, From the alien woman whose talk is smooth,
content_old: 16 It will save you from the forbidden woman, From the alien woman whose talk is smooth,

content: 17 Who forsakes the companion of her youth And disregards the covenant of her God.
content_old: 17 Who forsakes the companion of her youth And disregards the covenant of her God.

content: 18 Her house sinks down to Death, And her course leads to the shades.
content_old: 18 Her house sinks down to Death, And her course leads to the shades.

content: 19 All who go to her cannot return And find again the paths of life.
content_old: 19 All who go to her cannot return And find again the paths of life.

content: 20 So follow the way of the good And keep to the paths of the just.
content_old: 20 So follow the way of the good And keep to the paths of the just.

content: 21 For the upright will inhabit the earth, The blameless will remain in it.
content_old: 21 For the upright will inhabit the earth, The blameless will remain in it.

content: 1 My son, do not forget my teaching, But let your mind retain my commandments;
content_old: 1 My son, do not forget my teaching, But let your mind retain my commandments;

content: 2 For they will bestow on you length of days, Years of life and well-being.
content_old: 2 For they will bestow on you length of days, Years of life and well-being.

content: 3 Let fidelity and steadfastness not leave you; Bind them about your throat, Write them on the tablet of your mind,
content_old: 3 Let fidelity and steadfastness not leave you; Bind them about your throat, Write them on the tablet of your mind,

content: 4 And you will find favor and approbation In the eyes of God and man.
content_old: 4 And you will find favor and approbation In the eyes of God and man.

content: 5 Trust in the LORD with all your heart, And do not rely on your own understanding.
content_old: 5 Trust in the LORD with all your heart, And do not rely on your own understanding.

content: 6 In all your ways acknowledge Him, And He will make your paths smooth.
content_old: 6 In all your ways acknowledge Him, And He will make your paths smooth.

content: 7 Do not be wise in your own eyes; Fear the LORD and shun evil.
content_old: 7 Do not be wise in your own eyes; Fear the LORD and shun evil.

content: 8 It will be a cure for your body, A tonic for your bones.
content_old: 8 It will be a cure for your body, A tonic for your bones.

content: 9 Honor the LORD with your wealth, With the best of all your income,
content_old: 9 Honor the LORD with your wealth, With the best of all your income,

content: 10 And your barns will be filled with grain, Your vats will burst with new wine.
content_old: 10 And your barns will be filled with grain, Your vats will burst with new wine.

content: 11 Do not reject the discipline of the LORD, my son; Do not abhor His rebuke.
content_old: 11 Do not reject the discipline of the LORD, my son; Do not abhor His rebuke.

content: 12 For whom the LORD loves, He rebukes, As a father the son whom he favors.
content_old: 12 For whom the LORD loves, He rebukes, As a father the son whom he favors.

content: 13 Happy is the man who finds wisdom, The man who attains understanding.
content_old: 13 Happy is the man who finds wisdom, The man who attains understanding.

content: 14 Her value in trade is better than silver, Her yield, greater than gold.
content_old: 14 Her value in trade is better than silver, Her yield, greater than gold.

content: 15 She is more precious than rubies; All of your goods cannot equal her.
content_old: 15 She is more precious than rubies; All of your goods cannot equal her.

content: 16 In her right hand is length of days, In her left, riches and honor.
content_old: 16 In her right hand is length of days, In her left, riches and honor.

content: 17 Her ways are pleasant ways, And all her paths, peaceful.
content_old: 17 Her ways are pleasant ways, And all her paths, peaceful.

content: 18 She is a tree of life to those who grasp her, And whoever holds on to her is happy.
content_old: 18 She is a tree of life to those who grasp her, And whoever holds on to her is happy.

content: 19 The LORD founded the earth by wisdom; He established the heavens by understanding;
content_old: 19 The LORD founded the earth by wisdom; He established the heavens by understanding;

content: 20 By His knowledge the depths burst apart, And the skies distilled dew.
content_old: 20 By His knowledge the depths burst apart, And the skies distilled dew.

content: 21 My son, do not lose sight of them; Hold on to resourcefulness and foresight.
content_old: 21 My son, do not lose sight of them; Hold on to resourcefulness and foresight.

content: 22 They will give life to your spirit And grace to your throat.
content_old: 22 They will give life to your spirit And grace to your throat.

content: 23 Then you will go your way safely And not injure your feet.
content_old: 23 Then you will go your way safely And not injure your feet.

content: 24 When you lie down you will be unafraid; You will lie down and your sleep will be sweet.
content_old: 24 When you lie down you will be unafraid; You will lie down and your sleep will be sweet.

content: 25 You will not fear sudden terror Or the disaster that comes upon the wicked,
content_old: 25 You will not fear sudden terror Or the disaster that comes upon the wicked,

content: 26 For the LORD will be your trust; He will keep your feet from being caught.
content_old: 26 For the LORD will be your trust; He will keep your feet from being caught.

content: 27 Do not withhold good from one who deserves it When you have the power to do it.
content_old: 27 Do not withhold good from one who deserves it When you have the power to do it.

content: 28 Do not say to your fellow, “Come back again; I’ll give it to you tomorrow,” when you have it with you.
content_old: 28 Do not say to your fellow, “Come back again; I’ll give it to you tomorrow,” when you have it with you.

content: 29 Do not devise harm against your fellow Who lives trustfully with you.
content_old: 29 Do not devise harm against your fellow Who lives trustfully with you.

content: 30 Do not quarrel with a man for no cause, When he has done you no harm.
content_old: 30 Do not quarrel with a man for no cause, When he has done you no harm.

content: 31 Do not envy a lawless man, Or choose any of his ways;
content_old: 31 Do not envy a lawless man, Or choose any of his ways;

content: 32 For the devious man is an abomination to the LORD, But He is intimate with the straightforward.
content_old: 32 For the devious man is an abomination to the LORD, But He is intimate with the straightforward.

content: 33 The curse of the LORD is on the house of the wicked, But He blesses the abode of the righteous.
content_old: 33 The curse of the LORD is on the house of the wicked, But He blesses the abode of the righteous.

content: 34 At scoffers He scoffs, But to the lowly He shows grace.
content_old: 34 At scoffers He scoffs, But to the lowly He shows grace.

content: 1 Sons, heed the discipline of a father; Listen and learn discernment,
content_old: 1 Sons, heed the discipline of a father; Listen and learn discernment,

content: 2 For I give you good instruction; Do not forsake my teaching.
content_old: 2 For I give you good instruction; Do not forsake my teaching.

content: 3 Once I was a son to my father, The tender darling of my mother.
content_old: 3 Once I was a son to my father, The tender darling of my mother.

content: 4 He instructed me and said to me, “Let your mind hold on to my words; Keep my commandments and you will live.
content_old: 4 He instructed me and said to me, “Let your mind hold on to my words; Keep my commandments and you will live.

content: 5 Acquire wisdom, acquire discernment; Do not forget and do not swerve from my words.
content_old: 5 Acquire wisdom, acquire discernment; Do not forget and do not swerve from my words.

content: 6 Do not forsake her and she will guard you; Love her and she will protect you.
content_old: 6 Do not forsake her and she will guard you; Love her and she will protect you.

content: 7 The beginning of wisdom is—acquire wisdom; With all your acquisitions, acquire discernment.
content_old: 7 The beginning of wisdom is—acquire wisdom; With all your acquisitions, acquire discernment.

content: 8 Hug her to you and she will exalt you; She will bring you honor if you embrace her.
content_old: 8 Hug her to you and she will exalt you; She will bring you honor if you embrace her.

content: 9 She will adorn your head with a graceful wreath; Crown you with a glorious diadem.”
content_old: 9 She will adorn your head with a graceful wreath; Crown you with a glorious diadem.”

content: 10 My son, heed and take in my words, And you will have many years of life.
content_old: 10 My son, heed and take in my words, And you will have many years of life.

content: 11 I instruct you in the way of wisdom; I guide you in straight courses.
content_old: 11 I instruct you in the way of wisdom; I guide you in straight courses.

content: 12 You will walk without breaking stride; When you run, you will not stumble.
content_old: 12 You will walk without breaking stride; When you run, you will not stumble.

content: 13 Hold fast to discipline; do not let go; Keep it; it is your life.
content_old: 13 Hold fast to discipline; do not let go; Keep it; it is your life.

content: 14 Do not enter on the path of the wicked; Do not walk on the way of evil men.
content_old: 14 Do not enter on the path of the wicked; Do not walk on the way of evil men.

content: 15 Avoid it; do not pass through it; Turn away from it; pass it by.
content_old: 15 Avoid it; do not pass through it; Turn away from it; pass it by.

content: 16 For they cannot sleep unless they have done evil; Unless they make someone fall they are robbed of sleep.
content_old: 16 For they cannot sleep unless they have done evil; Unless they make someone fall they are robbed of sleep.

content: 17 They eat the bread of wickedness And drink the wine of lawlessness.
content_old: 17 They eat the bread of wickedness And drink the wine of lawlessness.

content: 18 The path of the righteous is like radiant sunlight, Ever brightening until noon.
content_old: 18 The path of the righteous is like radiant sunlight, Ever brightening until noon.

content: 19 The way of the wicked is all darkness; They do not know what will make them stumble.
content_old: 19 The way of the wicked is all darkness; They do not know what will make them stumble.

content: 20 My son, listen to my speech; Incline your ear to my words.
content_old: 20 My son, listen to my speech; Incline your ear to my words.

content: 21 Do not lose sight of them; Keep them in your mind.
content_old: 21 Do not lose sight of them; Keep them in your mind.

content: 22 They are life to him who finds them, Healing for his whole body.
content_old: 22 They are life to him who finds them, Healing for his whole body.

content: 23 More than all that you guard, guard your mind, For it is the source of life.
content_old: 23 More than all that you guard, guard your mind, For it is the source of life.

content: 24 Put crooked speech away from you; Keep devious talk far from you.
content_old: 24 Put crooked speech away from you; Keep devious talk far from you.

content: 25 Let your eyes look forward, Your gaze be straight ahead.
content_old: 25 Let your eyes look forward, Your gaze be straight ahead.

content: 26 Survey the course you take, And all your ways will prosper.
content_old: 26 Survey the course you take, And all your ways will prosper.

content: 1 My son, listen to my wisdom; Incline your ear to my insight,
content_old: 1 My son, listen to my wisdom; Incline your ear to my insight,

content: 2 That you may have foresight, While your lips hold fast to knowledge.
content_old: 2 That you may have foresight, While your lips hold fast to knowledge.

content: 3 For the lips of a forbidden woman drip honey; Her mouth is smoother than oil;
content_old: 3 For the lips of a forbidden woman drip honey; Her mouth is smoother than oil;

content: 4 But in the end she is as bitter as wormwood, Sharp as a two-edged sword.
content_old: 4 But in the end she is as bitter as wormwood, Sharp as a two-edged sword.

content: 5 Her feet go down to Death; Her steps take hold of Sheol.
content_old: 5 Her feet go down to Death; Her steps take hold of Sheol.

content: 6 She does not chart a path of life; Her course meanders for lack of knowledge.
content_old: 6 She does not chart a path of life; Her course meanders for lack of knowledge.

content: 7 So now, sons, pay heed to me, And do not swerve from the words of my mouth.
content_old: 7 So now, sons, pay heed to me, And do not swerve from the words of my mouth.

content: 8 Keep yourself far away from her; Do not come near the doorway of her house
content_old: 8 Keep yourself far away from her; Do not come near the doorway of her house

content: 9 Lest you give up your vigor to others, Your years to a ruthless one;
content_old: 9 Lest you give up your vigor to others, Your years to a ruthless one;

content: 10 Lest strangers eat their fill of your strength, And your toil be for the house of another;
content_old: 10 Lest strangers eat their fill of your strength, And your toil be for the house of another;

content: 11 And in the end you roar, When your flesh and body are consumed,
content_old: 11 And in the end you roar, When your flesh and body are consumed,

content: 12 And say, “O how I hated discipline, And heartily spurned rebuke.
content_old: 12 And say, “O how I hated discipline, And heartily spurned rebuke.

content: 13 I did not pay heed to my teachers, Or incline my ear to my instructors.
content_old: 13 I did not pay heed to my teachers, Or incline my ear to my instructors.

content: 14 Soon I was in dire trouble Amidst the assembled congregation.”
content_old: 14 Soon I was in dire trouble Amidst the assembled congregation.”

content: 15 Drink water from your own cistern, Running water from your own well.
content_old: 15 Drink water from your own cistern, Running water from your own well.

content: 16 Your springs will gush forth In streams in the public squares.
content_old: 16 Your springs will gush forth In streams in the public squares.

content: 17 They will be yours alone, Others having no part with you.
content_old: 17 They will be yours alone, Others having no part with you.

content: 18 Let your fountain be blessed; Find joy in the wife of your youth—
content_old: 18 Let your fountain be blessed; Find joy in the wife of your youth—

content: 19 A loving doe, a graceful mountain goat. Let her breasts satisfy you at all times; Be infatuated with love of her always.
content_old: 19 A loving doe, a graceful mountain goat. Let her breasts satisfy you at all times; Be infatuated with love of her always.

content: 20 Why be infatuated, my son, with a forbidden woman? Why clasp the bosom of an alien woman?
content_old: 20 Why be infatuated, my son, with a forbidden woman? Why clasp the bosom of an alien woman?

content: 21 For a man’s ways are before the eyes of God; He surveys his entire course.
content_old: 21 For a man’s ways are before the eyes of God; He surveys his entire course.

content: 22 The wicked man will be trapped in his iniquities; He will be caught up in the ropes of his sin.
content_old: 22 The wicked man will be trapped in his iniquities; He will be caught up in the ropes of his sin.

content: 1 My son, if you have stood surety for your fellow, Given your hand for another,
content_old: 1 My son, if you have stood surety for your fellow, Given your hand for another,

content: 2 You have been trapped by the words of your mouth, Snared by the words of your mouth.
content_old: 2 You have been trapped by the words of your mouth, Snared by the words of your mouth.

content: 3 Do this, then, my son, to extricate yourself, For you have come into the power of your fellow: Go grovel—and badger your fellow;
content_old: 3 Do this, then, my son, to extricate yourself, For you have come into the power of your fellow: Go grovel—and badger your fellow;

content: 4 Give your eyes no sleep, Your pupils no slumber.
content_old: 4 Give your eyes no sleep, Your pupils no slumber.

content: 5 Save yourself like a deer out of the handof a hunter, Like a bird out of the hand of a fowler.
content_old: 5 Save yourself like a deer out of the handof a hunter, Like a bird out of the hand of a fowler.

content: 6 Lazybones, go to the ant; Study its ways and learn.
content_old: 6 Lazybones, go to the ant; Study its ways and learn.

content: 7 Without leaders, officers, or rulers,
content_old: 7 Without leaders, officers, or rulers,

content: 8 It lays up its stores during the summer, Gathers in its food at the harvest.
content_old: 8 It lays up its stores during the summer, Gathers in its food at the harvest.

content: 9 How long will you lie there, lazybones; When will you wake from your sleep?
content_old: 9 How long will you lie there, lazybones; When will you wake from your sleep?

content: 10 A bit more sleep, a bit more slumber, A bit more hugging yourself in bed,
content_old: 10 A bit more sleep, a bit more slumber, A bit more hugging yourself in bed,

content: 11 And poverty will come calling upon you, And want, like a man with a shield.
content_old: 11 And poverty will come calling upon you, And want, like a man with a shield.

content: 12 A scoundrel, an evil man Lives by crooked speech,
content_old: 12 A scoundrel, an evil man Lives by crooked speech,

content: 13 Winking his eyes, Shuffling his feet, Pointing his finger.
content_old: 13 Winking his eyes, Shuffling his feet, Pointing his finger.

content: 14 Duplicity is in his heart; He plots evil all the time; He incites quarrels.
content_old: 14 Duplicity is in his heart; He plots evil all the time; He incites quarrels.

content: 15 Therefore calamity will come upon him without warning; Suddenly he will be broken beyond repair.
content_old: 15 Therefore calamity will come upon him without warning; Suddenly he will be broken beyond repair.

content: 16 Six things the LORD hates; Seven are an abomination to Him:
content_old: 16 Six things the LORD hates; Seven are an abomination to Him:

content: 17 A haughty bearing, A lying tongue, Hands that shed innocent blood,
content_old: 17 A haughty bearing, A lying tongue, Hands that shed innocent blood,

content: 18 A mind that hatches evil plots, Feet quick to run to evil,
content_old: 18 A mind that hatches evil plots, Feet quick to run to evil,

content: 19 A false witness testifying lies, And one who incites brothers to quarrel.
content_old: 19 A false witness testifying lies, And one who incites brothers to quarrel.

content: 20 My son, keep your father’s commandment; Do not forsake your mother’s teaching.
content_old: 20 My son, keep your father’s commandment; Do not forsake your mother’s teaching.

content: 21 Tie them over your heart always; Bind them around your throat.
content_old: 21 Tie them over your heart always; Bind them around your throat.

content: 22 When you walk it will lead you; When you lie down it will watch over you; And when you are awake it will talk with you.
content_old: 22 When you walk it will lead you; When you lie down it will watch over you; And when you are awake it will talk with you.

content: 23 For the commandment is a lamp, The teaching is a light, And the way to life is the rebuke that disciplines.
content_old: 23 For the commandment is a lamp, The teaching is a light, And the way to life is the rebuke that disciplines.

content: 24 It will keep you from an evil woman, From the smooth tongue of a forbidden woman.
content_old: 24 It will keep you from an evil woman, From the smooth tongue of a forbidden woman.

content: 25 Do not lust for her beauty Or let her captivate you with her eyes.
content_old: 25 Do not lust for her beauty Or let her captivate you with her eyes.

content: 26 The last loaf of bread will go for a harlot; A married woman will snare a person of honor.
content_old: 26 The last loaf of bread will go for a harlot; A married woman will snare a person of honor.

content: 27 Can a man rake embers into his bosom Without burning his clothes?
content_old: 27 Can a man rake embers into his bosom Without burning his clothes?

content: 28 Can a man walk on live coals Without scorching his feet?
content_old: 28 Can a man walk on live coals Without scorching his feet?

content: 29 It is the same with one who sleeps with his fellow’s wife; None who touches her will go unpunished.
content_old: 29 It is the same with one who sleeps with his fellow’s wife; None who touches her will go unpunished.

content: 30 A thief is not held in contempt For stealing to appease his hunger;
content_old: 30 A thief is not held in contempt For stealing to appease his hunger;

content: 31 Yet if caught he must pay sevenfold; He must give up all he owns.
content_old: 31 Yet if caught he must pay sevenfold; He must give up all he owns.

content: 32 He who commits adultery is devoid of sense; Only one who would destroy himself does such a thing.
content_old: 32 He who commits adultery is devoid of sense; Only one who would destroy himself does such a thing.

content: 33 He will meet with disease and disgrace; His reproach will never be expunged.
content_old: 33 He will meet with disease and disgrace; His reproach will never be expunged.

content: 34 The fury of the husband will be passionate; He will show no pity on his day of vengeance.
content_old: 34 The fury of the husband will be passionate; He will show no pity on his day of vengeance.

content: 1 My son, heed my words; And store up my commandments with you.
content_old: 1 My son, heed my words; And store up my commandments with you.

content: 2 Keep my commandments and live, My teaching, as the apple of your eye.
content_old: 2 Keep my commandments and live, My teaching, as the apple of your eye.

content: 3 Bind them on your fingers; Write them on the tablet of your mind.
content_old: 3 Bind them on your fingers; Write them on the tablet of your mind.

content: 4 Say to Wisdom, “You are my sister,” And call Understanding a kinswoman.
content_old: 4 Say to Wisdom, “You are my sister,” And call Understanding a kinswoman.

content: 5 She will guard you from a forbidden woman; From an alien woman whose talk is smooth.
content_old: 5 She will guard you from a forbidden woman; From an alien woman whose talk is smooth.

content: 6 From the window of my house, Through my lattice, I looked out
content_old: 6 From the window of my house, Through my lattice, I looked out

content: 7 And saw among the simple, Noticed among the youths, A lad devoid of sense.
content_old: 7 And saw among the simple, Noticed among the youths, A lad devoid of sense.

content: 8 He was crossing the street near her corner, Walking toward her house
content_old: 8 He was crossing the street near her corner, Walking toward her house

content: 9 In the dusk of evening, In the dark hours of night.
content_old: 9 In the dusk of evening, In the dark hours of night.

content: 10 A woman comes toward him Dressed like a harlot, with set purpose.
content_old: 10 A woman comes toward him Dressed like a harlot, with set purpose.

content: 11 She is bustling and restive; She is never at home.
content_old: 11 She is bustling and restive; She is never at home.

content: 12 Now in the street, now in the square, She lurks at every corner.
content_old: 12 Now in the street, now in the square, She lurks at every corner.

content: 13 She lays hold of him and kisses him; Brazenly she says to him,
content_old: 13 She lays hold of him and kisses him; Brazenly she says to him,

content: 14 “I had to make a sacrifice of well-being; Today I fulfilled my vows.
content_old: 14 “I had to make a sacrifice of well-being; Today I fulfilled my vows.

content: 15 Therefore I have come out to you, Seeking you, and have found you.
content_old: 15 Therefore I have come out to you, Seeking you, and have found you.

content: 16 I have decked my couch with covers Of dyed Egyptian linen;
content_old: 16 I have decked my couch with covers Of dyed Egyptian linen;

content: 17 I have sprinkled my bed With myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
content_old: 17 I have sprinkled my bed With myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

content: 18 Let us drink our fill of love till morning; Let us delight in amorous embrace.
content_old: 18 Let us drink our fill of love till morning; Let us delight in amorous embrace.

content: 19 For the man of the house is away; He is off on a distant journey.
content_old: 19 For the man of the house is away; He is off on a distant journey.

content: 20 He took his bag of money with him And will return only at mid-month.”
content_old: 20 He took his bag of money with him And will return only at mid-month.”

content: 21 She sways him with her eloquence, Turns him aside with her smooth talk.
content_old: 21 She sways him with her eloquence, Turns him aside with her smooth talk.

content: 22 Thoughtlessly he follows her, Like an ox going to the slaughter, Like a fool to the stocks for punishment—
content_old: 22 Thoughtlessly he follows her, Like an ox going to the slaughter, Like a fool to the stocks for punishment—

content: 23 Until the arrow pierces his liver. He is like a bird rushing into a trap, Not knowing his life is at stake.
content_old: 23 Until the arrow pierces his liver. He is like a bird rushing into a trap, Not knowing his life is at stake.

content: 24 Now, sons, listen to me; Pay attention to my words;
content_old: 24 Now, sons, listen to me; Pay attention to my words;

content: 25 Let your mind not wander down her ways; Do not stray onto her paths.
content_old: 25 Let your mind not wander down her ways; Do not stray onto her paths.

content: 26 For many are those she has struck dead, And numerous are her victims.
content_old: 26 For many are those she has struck dead, And numerous are her victims.

content: 1 It is Wisdom calling, Understanding raising her voice.
content_old: 1 It is Wisdom calling, Understanding raising her voice.

content: 2 She takes her stand at the topmost heights, By the wayside, at the crossroads,
content_old: 2 She takes her stand at the topmost heights, By the wayside, at the crossroads,

content: 3 Near the gates at the city entrance; At the entryways, she shouts,
content_old: 3 Near the gates at the city entrance; At the entryways, she shouts,

content: 4 “O men, I call to you; My cry is to all mankind.
content_old: 4 “O men, I call to you; My cry is to all mankind.

content: 5 O simple ones, learn shrewdness; O dullards, instruct your minds.
content_old: 5 O simple ones, learn shrewdness; O dullards, instruct your minds.

content: 6 Listen, for I speak noble things; Uprightness comes from my lips;
content_old: 6 Listen, for I speak noble things; Uprightness comes from my lips;

content: 7 My mouth utters truth; Wickedness is abhorrent to my lips.
content_old: 7 My mouth utters truth; Wickedness is abhorrent to my lips.

content: 8 All my words are just, None of them perverse or crooked;
content_old: 8 All my words are just, None of them perverse or crooked;

content: 9 All are straightforward to the intelligent man, And right to those who have attained knowledge.
content_old: 9 All are straightforward to the intelligent man, And right to those who have attained knowledge.

content: 10 Accept my discipline rather than silver, Knowledge rather than choice gold.
content_old: 10 Accept my discipline rather than silver, Knowledge rather than choice gold.

content: 11 For wisdom is better than rubies; No goods can equal her.
content_old: 11 For wisdom is better than rubies; No goods can equal her.

content: 12 “I, Wisdom, live with Prudence; I attain knowledge and foresight.
content_old: 12 “I, Wisdom, live with Prudence; I attain knowledge and foresight.

content: 13 To fear the LORD is to hate evil; I hate pride, arrogance, the evil way, And duplicity in speech.
content_old: 13 To fear the LORD is to hate evil; I hate pride, arrogance, the evil way, And duplicity in speech.

content: 14 Mine are counsel and resourcefulness; I am understanding; courage is mine.
content_old: 14 Mine are counsel and resourcefulness; I am understanding; courage is mine.

content: 15 Through me kings reign And rulers decree just laws;
content_old: 15 Through me kings reign And rulers decree just laws;

content: 16 Through me princes rule, Great men and all the righteous judges.
content_old: 16 Through me princes rule, Great men and all the righteous judges.

content: 17 Those who love me I love, And those who seek me will find me.
content_old: 17 Those who love me I love, And those who seek me will find me.

content: 18 Riches and honor belong to me, Enduring wealth and success.
content_old: 18 Riches and honor belong to me, Enduring wealth and success.

content: 19 My fruit is better than gold, fine gold, And my produce better than choice silver.
content_old: 19 My fruit is better than gold, fine gold, And my produce better than choice silver.

content: 20 I walk on the way of righteousness, On the paths of justice.
content_old: 20 I walk on the way of righteousness, On the paths of justice.

content: 21 I endow those who love me with substance; I will fill their treasuries.
content_old: 21 I endow those who love me with substance; I will fill their treasuries.

content: 22 “The LORD created me at the beginning of His course As the first of His works of old.
content_old: 22 “The LORD created me at the beginning of His course As the first of His works of old.

content: 23 In the distant past I was fashioned, At the beginning, at the origin of earth.
content_old: 23 In the distant past I was fashioned, At the beginning, at the origin of earth.

content: 24 There was still no deep when I was brought forth, No springs rich in water;
content_old: 24 There was still no deep when I was brought forth, No springs rich in water;

content: 25 Before the mountains were sunk, Before the hills I was born.
content_old: 25 Before the mountains were sunk, Before the hills I was born.

content: 26 He had not yet made earth and fields, Or the world’s first clumps of clay.
content_old: 26 He had not yet made earth and fields, Or the world’s first clumps of clay.

content: 27 I was there when He set the heavens into place; When He fixed the horizon upon the deep;
content_old: 27 I was there when He set the heavens into place; When He fixed the horizon upon the deep;

content: 28 When He made the heavens above firm, And the fountains of the deep gushed forth;
content_old: 28 When He made the heavens above firm, And the fountains of the deep gushed forth;

content: 29 When He assigned the sea its limits, So that its waters never transgress His command; When He fixed the foundations of the earth,
content_old: 29 When He assigned the sea its limits, So that its waters never transgress His command; When He fixed the foundations of the earth,

content: 30 I was with Him as a confidant, A source of delight every day, Rejoicing before Him at all times,
content_old: 30 I was with Him as a confidant, A source of delight every day, Rejoicing before Him at all times,

content: 31 Rejoicing in His inhabited world, Finding delight with mankind.
content_old: 31 Rejoicing in His inhabited world, Finding delight with mankind.

content: 32 Now, sons, listen to me; Happy are they who keep my ways.
content_old: 32 Now, sons, listen to me; Happy are they who keep my ways.

content: 33 Heed discipline and become wise; Do not spurn it.
content_old: 33 Heed discipline and become wise; Do not spurn it.

content: 34 Happy is the man who listens to me, Coming early to my gates each day, Waiting outside my doors.
content_old: 34 Happy is the man who listens to me, Coming early to my gates each day, Waiting outside my doors.

content: 35 For he who finds me finds life And obtains favor from the LORD.
content_old: 35 For he who finds me finds life And obtains favor from the LORD.

content: 1 Wisdom has built her house, She has hewn her seven pillars.
content_old: 1 Wisdom has built her house, She has hewn her seven pillars.

content: 2 She has prepared the feast, Mixed the wine, And also set the table.
content_old: 2 She has prepared the feast, Mixed the wine, And also set the table.

content: 3 She has sent out her maids to announce On the heights of the town,
content_old: 3 She has sent out her maids to announce On the heights of the town,

content: 4 “Let the simple enter here”; To those devoid of sense she says,
content_old: 4 “Let the simple enter here”; To those devoid of sense she says,

content: 5 “Come, eat my food And drink the wine that I have mixed;
content_old: 5 “Come, eat my food And drink the wine that I have mixed;

content: 6 Give up simpleness and live, Walk in the way of understanding.”
content_old: 6 Give up simpleness and live, Walk in the way of understanding.”

content: 7 To correct a scoffer, Or rebuke a wicked man for his blemish, Is to call down abuse on oneself.
content_old: 7 To correct a scoffer, Or rebuke a wicked man for his blemish, Is to call down abuse on oneself.

content: 8 Do not rebuke a scoffer, for he will hate you; Reprove a wise man, and he will love you.
content_old: 8 Do not rebuke a scoffer, for he will hate you; Reprove a wise man, and he will love you.

content: 9 Instruct a wise man, and he will grow wiser; Teach a righteous man, and he will gain in learning.
content_old: 9 Instruct a wise man, and he will grow wiser; Teach a righteous man, and he will gain in learning.

content: 10 The beginning of wisdom is fear of the LORD, And knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.
content_old: 10 The beginning of wisdom is fear of the LORD, And knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.

content: 11 For through me your days will increase, And years be added to your life.
content_old: 11 For through me your days will increase, And years be added to your life.

content: 12 If you are wise, you are wise for yourself; If you are a scoffer, you bear it alone.
content_old: 12 If you are wise, you are wise for yourself; If you are a scoffer, you bear it alone.

content: 13 The stupid woman bustles about; She is simple and knows nothing.
content_old: 13 The stupid woman bustles about; She is simple and knows nothing.

content: 14 She sits in the doorway of her house, Or on a chair at the heights of the town,
content_old: 14 She sits in the doorway of her house, Or on a chair at the heights of the town,

content: 15 Calling to all the wayfarers Who go about their own affairs,
content_old: 15 Calling to all the wayfarers Who go about their own affairs,

content: 16 “Let the simple enter here”; And to those devoid of sense she says,
content_old: 16 “Let the simple enter here”; And to those devoid of sense she says,

content: 17 “Stolen waters are sweet, And bread eaten furtively is tasty.”
content_old: 17 “Stolen waters are sweet, And bread eaten furtively is tasty.”

content: 1 The proverbs of Solomon: A wise son brings joy to his father; A dull son is his mother’s sorrow.
content_old: 1 The proverbs of Solomon: A wise son brings joy to his father; A dull son is his mother’s sorrow.

content: 2 Ill-gotten wealth is of no avail, But righteousness saves from death.
content_old: 2 Ill-gotten wealth is of no avail, But righteousness saves from death.

content: 3 The LORD will not let the righteous go hungry, But He denies the wicked what they crave.
content_old: 3 The LORD will not let the righteous go hungry, But He denies the wicked what they crave.

content: 4 Negligent hands cause poverty, But diligent hands enrich.
content_old: 4 Negligent hands cause poverty, But diligent hands enrich.

content: 5 He who lays in stores during the summer is a capable son, But he who sleeps during the harvest is an incompetent.
content_old: 5 He who lays in stores during the summer is a capable son, But he who sleeps during the harvest is an incompetent.

content: 6 Blessings light upon the head of the righteous, But lawlessness covers the mouth of the wicked.
content_old: 6 Blessings light upon the head of the righteous, But lawlessness covers the mouth of the wicked.

content: 7 The name of the righteous is invoked in blessing, But the fame of the wicked rots.
content_old: 7 The name of the righteous is invoked in blessing, But the fame of the wicked rots.

content: 8 He whose heart is wise accepts commands, But he whose speech is foolish comes to grief.
content_old: 8 He whose heart is wise accepts commands, But he whose speech is foolish comes to grief.

content: 9 He who lives blamelessly lives safely, But he who walks a crooked path will be found out.
content_old: 9 He who lives blamelessly lives safely, But he who walks a crooked path will be found out.

content: 10 He who winks his eye causes sorrow; He whose speech is foolish comes to grief.
content_old: 10 He who winks his eye causes sorrow; He whose speech is foolish comes to grief.

content: 11 The mouth of the righteous is a fountain of life, But lawlessness covers the mouth of the wicked.
content_old: 11 The mouth of the righteous is a fountain of life, But lawlessness covers the mouth of the wicked.

content: 12 Hatred stirs up strife, But love covers up all faults.
content_old: 12 Hatred stirs up strife, But love covers up all faults.

content: 13 Wisdom is to be found on the lips of the intelligent, But a rod is ready for the back of the senseless.
content_old: 13 Wisdom is to be found on the lips of the intelligent, But a rod is ready for the back of the senseless.

content: 14 The wise store up knowledge; The mouth of the fool is an imminent ruin.
content_old: 14 The wise store up knowledge; The mouth of the fool is an imminent ruin.

content: 15 The wealth of a rich man is his fortress; The poverty of the poor is his ruin.
content_old: 15 The wealth of a rich man is his fortress; The poverty of the poor is his ruin.

content: 16 The labor of the righteous man makes for life; The produce of the wicked man makes for want.
content_old: 16 The labor of the righteous man makes for life; The produce of the wicked man makes for want.

content: 17 He who follows discipline shows the way to life, But he who ignores reproof leads astray.
content_old: 17 He who follows discipline shows the way to life, But he who ignores reproof leads astray.

content: 18 He who conceals hatred has lying lips, While he who speaks forth slander is a dullard.
content_old: 18 He who conceals hatred has lying lips, While he who speaks forth slander is a dullard.

content: 19 Where there is much talking, there is no lack of transgressing, But he who curbs his tongue shows sense.
content_old: 19 Where there is much talking, there is no lack of transgressing, But he who curbs his tongue shows sense.

content: 20 The tongue of a righteous man is choice silver, But the mind of the wicked is of little worth.
content_old: 20 The tongue of a righteous man is choice silver, But the mind of the wicked is of little worth.

content: 21 The lips of the righteous sustain many, But fools die for lack of sense.
content_old: 21 The lips of the righteous sustain many, But fools die for lack of sense.

content: 22 It is the blessing of the LORD that enriches, And no toil can increase it.
content_old: 22 It is the blessing of the LORD that enriches, And no toil can increase it.

content: 23 As mischief is sport for the dullard, So is wisdom for the man of understanding.
content_old: 23 As mischief is sport for the dullard, So is wisdom for the man of understanding.

content: 24 What the wicked man plots overtakes him; What the righteous desire is granted.
content_old: 24 What the wicked man plots overtakes him; What the righteous desire is granted.

content: 25 When the storm passes the wicked man is gone, But the righteous is an everlasting foundation.
content_old: 25 When the storm passes the wicked man is gone, But the righteous is an everlasting foundation.

content: 26 Like vinegar to the teeth, Like smoke to the eyes, Is a lazy man to those who send him on a mission.
content_old: 26 Like vinegar to the teeth, Like smoke to the eyes, Is a lazy man to those who send him on a mission.

content: 27 The fear of the LORD prolongs life, While the years of the wicked will be shortened.
content_old: 27 The fear of the LORD prolongs life, While the years of the wicked will be shortened.

content: 28 The righteous can look forward to joy, But the hope of the wicked is doomed.
content_old: 28 The righteous can look forward to joy, But the hope of the wicked is doomed.

content: 29 The way of the LORD is a stronghold for the blameless, But a ruin for evildoers.
content_old: 29 The way of the LORD is a stronghold for the blameless, But a ruin for evildoers.

content: 30 The righteous will never be shaken; The wicked will not inhabit the earth.
content_old: 30 The righteous will never be shaken; The wicked will not inhabit the earth.

content: 31 The mouth of the righteous produces wisdom, But the treacherous tongue shall be cut off.
content_old: 31 The mouth of the righteous produces wisdom, But the treacherous tongue shall be cut off.

content: 1 False scales are an abomination to the LORD; An honest weight pleases Him.
content_old: 1 False scales are an abomination to the LORD; An honest weight pleases Him.

content: 2 When arrogance appears, disgrace follows, But wisdom is with those who are unassuming.
content_old: 2 When arrogance appears, disgrace follows, But wisdom is with those who are unassuming.

content: 3 The integrity of the upright guides them; The deviousness of the treacherous leads them to ruin.
content_old: 3 The integrity of the upright guides them; The deviousness of the treacherous leads them to ruin.

content: 4 Wealth is of no avail on the day of wrath, But righteousness saves from death.
content_old: 4 Wealth is of no avail on the day of wrath, But righteousness saves from death.

content: 5 The righteousness of the blameless man smooths his way, But the wicked man is felled by his wickedness.
content_old: 5 The righteousness of the blameless man smooths his way, But the wicked man is felled by his wickedness.

content: 6 The righteousness of the upright saves them, But the treacherous are trapped by their malice.
content_old: 6 The righteousness of the upright saves them, But the treacherous are trapped by their malice.

content: 7 At death the hopes of a wicked man are doomed, And the ambition of evil men comes to nothing.
content_old: 7 At death the hopes of a wicked man are doomed, And the ambition of evil men comes to nothing.

content: 8 The righteous man is rescued from trouble And the wicked man takes his place.
content_old: 8 The righteous man is rescued from trouble And the wicked man takes his place.

content: 9 The impious man destroys his neighbor through speech, But through their knowledge the righteous are rescued.
content_old: 9 The impious man destroys his neighbor through speech, But through their knowledge the righteous are rescued.

content: 10 When the righteous prosper the city exults; When the wicked perish there are shouts of joy.
content_old: 10 When the righteous prosper the city exults; When the wicked perish there are shouts of joy.

content: 11 A city is built up by the blessing of the upright, But it is torn down by the speech of the wicked.
content_old: 11 A city is built up by the blessing of the upright, But it is torn down by the speech of the wicked.

content: 12 He who speaks contemptuously of his fellowman is devoid of sense; A prudent man keeps his peace.
content_old: 12 He who speaks contemptuously of his fellowman is devoid of sense; A prudent man keeps his peace.

content: 13 A base fellow gives away secrets, But a trustworthy soul keeps a confidence.
content_old: 13 A base fellow gives away secrets, But a trustworthy soul keeps a confidence.

content: 14 For want of strategy an army falls, But victory comes with much planning.
content_old: 14 For want of strategy an army falls, But victory comes with much planning.

content: 15 Harm awaits him who stands surety for another; He who spurns pledging shall be secure.
content_old: 15 Harm awaits him who stands surety for another; He who spurns pledging shall be secure.

content: 16 A graceful woman obtains honor; Ruthless men obtain wealth.
content_old: 16 A graceful woman obtains honor; Ruthless men obtain wealth.

content: 17 A kindly man benefits himself; A cruel man makes trouble for himself.
content_old: 17 A kindly man benefits himself; A cruel man makes trouble for himself.

content: 18 The wicked man earns illusory wages, But he who sows righteousness has a true reward.
content_old: 18 The wicked man earns illusory wages, But he who sows righteousness has a true reward.

content: 19 Righteousness is a prop of life, But to pursue evil leads to death.
content_old: 19 Righteousness is a prop of life, But to pursue evil leads to death.

content: 20 Men of crooked mind are an abomination to the LORD, But those whose way is blameless please Him.
content_old: 20 Men of crooked mind are an abomination to the LORD, But those whose way is blameless please Him.

content: 21 Assuredly, the evil man will not escape, But the offspring of the righteous will be safe.
content_old: 21 Assuredly, the evil man will not escape, But the offspring of the righteous will be safe.

content: 22 Like a gold ring in the snout of a pig Is a beautiful woman bereft of sense.
content_old: 22 Like a gold ring in the snout of a pig Is a beautiful woman bereft of sense.

content: 23 What the righteous desire can only be good; What the wicked hope for wrath.
content_old: 23 What the righteous desire can only be good; What the wicked hope for wrath.

content: 24 One man gives generously and ends with more; Another stints on doing the right thing and incurs a loss.
content_old: 24 One man gives generously and ends with more; Another stints on doing the right thing and incurs a loss.

content: 25 A generous person enjoys prosperity; He who satisfies others shall himself be sated.
content_old: 25 A generous person enjoys prosperity; He who satisfies others shall himself be sated.

content: 26 He who withholds grain earns the curses of the people, But blessings are on the head of the one who dispenses it.
content_old: 26 He who withholds grain earns the curses of the people, But blessings are on the head of the one who dispenses it.

content: 27 He who earnestly seeks what is good pursues what is pleasing; He who is bent on evil, upon him it shall come.
content_old: 27 He who earnestly seeks what is good pursues what is pleasing; He who is bent on evil, upon him it shall come.

content: 28 He who trusts in his wealth shall fall, But the righteous shall flourish like foliage.
content_old: 28 He who trusts in his wealth shall fall, But the righteous shall flourish like foliage.

content: 29 He who makes trouble for his household shall inherit the wind; A fool is a slave to the wise-hearted.
content_old: 29 He who makes trouble for his household shall inherit the wind; A fool is a slave to the wise-hearted.

content: 30 The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life; A wise man captivates people.
content_old: 30 The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life; A wise man captivates people.

content: 1 He who loves discipline loves knowledge; He who spurns reproof is a brutish man.
content_old: 1 He who loves discipline loves knowledge; He who spurns reproof is a brutish man.

content: 2 A good man earns the favor of the LORD, A man of intrigues, His condemnation.
content_old: 2 A good man earns the favor of the LORD, A man of intrigues, His condemnation.

content: 3 A man cannot be established in wickedness, But the root of the righteous will not be shaken loose.
content_old: 3 A man cannot be established in wickedness, But the root of the righteous will not be shaken loose.

content: 4 A capable wife is a crown for her husband, But an incompetent one is like rot in his bones.
content_old: 4 A capable wife is a crown for her husband, But an incompetent one is like rot in his bones.

content: 5 The purposes of the righteous are justice, The schemes of the wicked are deceit.
content_old: 5 The purposes of the righteous are justice, The schemes of the wicked are deceit.

content: 6 The words of the wicked are a deadly ambush, But the speech of the upright saves them.
content_old: 6 The words of the wicked are a deadly ambush, But the speech of the upright saves them.

content: 7 Overturn the wicked and they are gone, But the house of the righteous will endure.
content_old: 7 Overturn the wicked and they are gone, But the house of the righteous will endure.

content: 8 A man is commended according to his intelligence; A twisted mind is held up to contempt.
content_old: 8 A man is commended according to his intelligence; A twisted mind is held up to contempt.

content: 9 Better to be lightly esteemed and have a servant Than to put on airs and have no food.
content_old: 9 Better to be lightly esteemed and have a servant Than to put on airs and have no food.

content: 10 A righteous man knows the needs of his beast, But the compassion of the wicked is cruelty.
content_old: 10 A righteous man knows the needs of his beast, But the compassion of the wicked is cruelty.

content: 11 He who tills his land shall have food in plenty, But he who pursues vanities is devoid of sense.
content_old: 11 He who tills his land shall have food in plenty, But he who pursues vanities is devoid of sense.

content: 12 The wicked covet the catch of evil men; The root of the righteous yields fruit.
content_old: 12 The wicked covet the catch of evil men; The root of the righteous yields fruit.

content: 13 Sinful speech is a trap for the evil man, But the righteous escapes from trouble.
content_old: 13 Sinful speech is a trap for the evil man, But the righteous escapes from trouble.

content: 14 A man gets his fill of good from the fruit of his speech; One is repaid in kind for one’s deeds.
content_old: 14 A man gets his fill of good from the fruit of his speech; One is repaid in kind for one’s deeds.

content: 15 The way of a fool is right in his own eyes; But the wise man accepts advice.
content_old: 15 The way of a fool is right in his own eyes; But the wise man accepts advice.

content: 16 A fool’s vexation is known at once, But a clever man conceals his humiliation.
content_old: 16 A fool’s vexation is known at once, But a clever man conceals his humiliation.

content: 17 He who testifies faithfully tells the truth, But a false witness, deceit.
content_old: 17 He who testifies faithfully tells the truth, But a false witness, deceit.

content: 18 There is blunt talk like sword-thrusts, But the speech of the wise is healing.
content_old: 18 There is blunt talk like sword-thrusts, But the speech of the wise is healing.

content: 19 Truthful speech abides forever, A lying tongue for but a moment.
content_old: 19 Truthful speech abides forever, A lying tongue for but a moment.

content: 20 Deceit is in the minds of those who plot evil; For those who plan good there is joy.
content_old: 20 Deceit is in the minds of those who plot evil; For those who plan good there is joy.

content: 21 No harm befalls the righteous, But the wicked have their fill of misfortune.
content_old: 21 No harm befalls the righteous, But the wicked have their fill of misfortune.

content: 22 Lying speech is an abomination to the LORD, But those who act faithfully please Him.
content_old: 22 Lying speech is an abomination to the LORD, But those who act faithfully please Him.

content: 23 A clever man conceals what he knows, But the mind of a dullard cries out folly.
content_old: 23 A clever man conceals what he knows, But the mind of a dullard cries out folly.

content: 24 The hand of the diligent wields authority; The negligent are held in subjection.
content_old: 24 The hand of the diligent wields authority; The negligent are held in subjection.

content: 25 If there is anxiety in a man’s mind let him quash it, And turn it into joy with a good word.
content_old: 25 If there is anxiety in a man’s mind let him quash it, And turn it into joy with a good word.

content: 26 A righteous man gives his friend direction, But the way of the wicked leads astray.
content_old: 26 A righteous man gives his friend direction, But the way of the wicked leads astray.

content: 27 A negligent man never has game to roast; A diligent man has precious wealth.
content_old: 27 A negligent man never has game to roast; A diligent man has precious wealth.

content: 1 A wise son—it is through the discipline of his father; A scoffer—he never heard reproof.
content_old: 1 A wise son—it is through the discipline of his father; A scoffer—he never heard reproof.

content: 2 A man enjoys good from the fruit of his speech; But out of the throat of the treacherous comes lawlessness.

content: 4 A lazy man craves, but has nothing; The diligent shall feast on rich fare.

content: 15 Good sense wins favor; The way of treacherous men is unchanging.

content: 16 Every clever man acts knowledgeably, But a dullard exposes his stupidity.

content: 21 Misfortune pursues sinners, But the righteous are well rewarded.

content: 24 He who spares the rod hates his son, But he who loves him disciplines him early.

content: 1 The wisest of women builds her house, But folly tears it down with its own hands.

content: 3 In the mouth of a fool is a rod of haughtiness, But the lips of the wise protect them.

content: 6 A scoffer seeks wisdom in vain, But knowledge comes easily to the intelligent man.

content: 7 Keep your distance from a dullard, For you will not learn wise speech.

content: 20 A pauper is despised even by his peers, But a rich man has many friends.

content: 22 Surely those who plan evil go astray, While those who plan good earn steadfast love.

content: 29 Patience results in much understanding; Impatience gets folly as its portion.

content: 34 Righteousness exalts a nation; Sin is a reproach to any people.
