content_old: 17 The first to plead his case seems right Till the other party examines him.

content: 18 The lot puts an end to strife And separates those locked in dispute.
content_old: 18 The lot puts an end to strife And separates those locked in dispute.

content: 19 A brother offended is more formidable than a stronghold; Such strife is like the bars of a fortress.
content_old: 19 A brother offended is more formidable than a stronghold; Such strife is like the bars of a fortress.

content: 20 A man’s belly is filled by the fruit of his mouth; He will be filled by the produce of his lips.
content_old: 20 A man’s belly is filled by the fruit of his mouth; He will be filled by the produce of his lips.

content: 21 Death and life are in the power of the tongue; Those who love it will eat its fruit.
content_old: 21 Death and life are in the power of the tongue; Those who love it will eat its fruit.

content: 22 He who finds a wife has found happiness And has won the favor of the LORD.
content_old: 22 He who finds a wife has found happiness And has won the favor of the LORD.

content: 23 The poor man speaks beseechingly; The rich man’s answer is harsh.
content_old: 23 The poor man speaks beseechingly; The rich man’s answer is harsh.

content: 1 Better a poor man who lives blamelessly Than one who speaks perversely and is a dullard.
content_old: 1 Better a poor man who lives blamelessly Than one who speaks perversely and is a dullard.

content: 2 A person without knowledge is surely not good; He who moves hurriedly blunders.
content_old: 2 A person without knowledge is surely not good; He who moves hurriedly blunders.

content: 3 A man’s folly subverts his way, And his heart rages against the LORD.
content_old: 3 A man’s folly subverts his way, And his heart rages against the LORD.

content: 4 Wealth makes many friends, But a poor man loses his last friend.
content_old: 4 Wealth makes many friends, But a poor man loses his last friend.

content: 5 A false witness will not go unpunished; He who testifies lies will not escape.
content_old: 5 A false witness will not go unpunished; He who testifies lies will not escape.

content: 6 Many court the favor of a great man, And all are the friends of a dispenser of gifts.
content_old: 6 Many court the favor of a great man, And all are the friends of a dispenser of gifts.

content: 7 All the brothers of a poor man despise him; How much more is he shunned by his friends! He who pursues words—they are of no avail.
content_old: 7 All the brothers of a poor man despise him; How much more is he shunned by his friends! He who pursues words—they are of no avail.

content: 8 He who acquires wisdom is his own best friend; He preserves understanding and attains happiness.
content_old: 8 He who acquires wisdom is his own best friend; He preserves understanding and attains happiness.

content: 9 A false witness will not go unpunished; He who testifies falsely is doomed.
content_old: 9 A false witness will not go unpunished; He who testifies falsely is doomed.

content: 10 Luxury is not fitting for a dullard, Much less that a servant rule over princes.
content_old: 10 Luxury is not fitting for a dullard, Much less that a servant rule over princes.

content: 11 A man shows intelligence by his forebearance; It is his glory when he overlooks an offense.
content_old: 11 A man shows intelligence by his forebearance; It is his glory when he overlooks an offense.

content: 12 The rage of a king is like the roar of a lion; His favor is like dew upon the grass.
content_old: 12 The rage of a king is like the roar of a lion; His favor is like dew upon the grass.

content: 13 A stupid son is a calamity to his father; The nagging of a wife is like the endless dripping of water.
content_old: 13 A stupid son is a calamity to his father; The nagging of a wife is like the endless dripping of water.

content: 14 Property and riches are bequeathed by fathers, But an efficient wife comes from the LORD.
content_old: 14 Property and riches are bequeathed by fathers, But an efficient wife comes from the LORD.

content: 15 Laziness induces sleep, And a negligent person will go hungry.
content_old: 15 Laziness induces sleep, And a negligent person will go hungry.

content: 16 He who has regard for his life pays regard to commandments; He who is heedless of his ways will die.
content_old: 16 He who has regard for his life pays regard to commandments; He who is heedless of his ways will die.

content: 17 He who is generous to the poor makes a loan to the LORD; He will repay him his due.
content_old: 17 He who is generous to the poor makes a loan to the LORD; He will repay him his due.

content: 18 Discipline your son while there is still hope, And do not set your heart on his destruction.
content_old: 18 Discipline your son while there is still hope, And do not set your heart on his destruction.

content: 19 A hot-tempered man incurs punishment; If you try to save him you will only make it worse.
content_old: 19 A hot-tempered man incurs punishment; If you try to save him you will only make it worse.

content: 20 Listen to advice and accept discipline In order that you may be wise in the end.
content_old: 20 Listen to advice and accept discipline In order that you may be wise in the end.

content: 21 Many designs are in a man’s mind, But it is the LORD’s plan that is accomplished.
content_old: 21 Many designs are in a man’s mind, But it is the LORD’s plan that is accomplished.

content: 22 Greed is a reproach to a man; Better be poor than a liar.
content_old: 22 Greed is a reproach to a man; Better be poor than a liar.

content: 23 He who fears the LORD earns life; He shall abide in contentment, Free from misfortune.
content_old: 23 He who fears the LORD earns life; He shall abide in contentment, Free from misfortune.

content: 24 The lazy man buries his hand in the bowl; He will not even bring it to his mouth.
content_old: 24 The lazy man buries his hand in the bowl; He will not even bring it to his mouth.

content: 25 Beat the scoffer and the simple will become clever; Reprove an intelligent man and he gains knowledge.
content_old: 25 Beat the scoffer and the simple will become clever; Reprove an intelligent man and he gains knowledge.

content: 26 A son who causes shame and disgrace Plunders his father, puts his mother to flight.
content_old: 26 A son who causes shame and disgrace Plunders his father, puts his mother to flight.

content: 27 My son, cease to stray from words of knowledge And receive discipline.
content_old: 27 My son, cease to stray from words of knowledge And receive discipline.

content: 28 A malicious witness scoffs at justice, And the speech of the wicked conceals mischief.
content_old: 28 A malicious witness scoffs at justice, And the speech of the wicked conceals mischief.

content: 1 Wine is a scoffer, strong drink a roisterer; He who is muddled by them will not grow wise.
content_old: 1 Wine is a scoffer, strong drink a roisterer; He who is muddled by them will not grow wise.

content: 2 The terror of a king is like the roar of a lion; He who provokes his anger risks his life.
content_old: 2 The terror of a king is like the roar of a lion; He who provokes his anger risks his life.

content: 3 It is honorable for a man to desist from strife, But every fool becomes embroiled.
content_old: 3 It is honorable for a man to desist from strife, But every fool becomes embroiled.

content: 4 In winter the lazy man does not plow; At harvesttime he seeks, and finds nothing.
content_old: 4 In winter the lazy man does not plow; At harvesttime he seeks, and finds nothing.

content: 5 The designs in a man’s mind are deep waters, But a man of understanding can draw them out.
content_old: 5 The designs in a man’s mind are deep waters, But a man of understanding can draw them out.

content: 6 He calls many a man his loyal friend, But who can find a faithful man?
content_old: 6 He calls many a man his loyal friend, But who can find a faithful man?

content: 7 The righteous man lives blamelessly; Happy are his children who come after him.
content_old: 7 The righteous man lives blamelessly; Happy are his children who come after him.

content: 8 The king seated on the throne of judgment Can winnow out all evil by his glance.
content_old: 8 The king seated on the throne of judgment Can winnow out all evil by his glance.

content: 9 Who can say, “I have cleansed my heart, I am purged of my sin”?
content_old: 9 Who can say, “I have cleansed my heart, I am purged of my sin”?

content: 10 False weights and false measures, Both are an abomination to the LORD.
content_old: 10 False weights and false measures, Both are an abomination to the LORD.

content: 11 A child may be dissembling in his behavior Even though his actions are blameless and proper.
content_old: 11 A child may be dissembling in his behavior Even though his actions are blameless and proper.

content: 12 The ear that hears, the eye that sees— The LORD made them both.
content_old: 12 The ear that hears, the eye that sees— The LORD made them both.

content: 13 Do not love sleep lest you be impoverished; Keep your eyes open and you will have plenty of food.
content_old: 13 Do not love sleep lest you be impoverished; Keep your eyes open and you will have plenty of food.

content: 14 “Bad, bad,” says the buyer, But having moved off, he congratulates himself.
content_old: 14 “Bad, bad,” says the buyer, But having moved off, he congratulates himself.

content: 15 Gold is plentiful, jewels abundant, But wise speech is a precious object.
content_old: 15 Gold is plentiful, jewels abundant, But wise speech is a precious object.

content: 16 Seize his garment, for he stood surety for another; Take it as a pledge, for he stood surety for an unfamiliar woman.
content_old: 16 Seize his garment, for he stood surety for another; Take it as a pledge, for he stood surety for an unfamiliar woman.

content: 17 Bread gained by fraud may be tasty to a man, But later his mouth will be filled with gravel.
content_old: 17 Bread gained by fraud may be tasty to a man, But later his mouth will be filled with gravel.

content: 18 Plans laid in council will succeed; Wage war with stratagems.
content_old: 18 Plans laid in council will succeed; Wage war with stratagems.

content: 19 He who gives away secrets is a base fellow; Do not take up with a garrulous man.
content_old: 19 He who gives away secrets is a base fellow; Do not take up with a garrulous man.

content: 20 One who reviles his father or mother, Light will fail him when darkness comes.
content_old: 20 One who reviles his father or mother, Light will fail him when darkness comes.

content: 21 An estate acquired in haste at the outset Will not be blessed in the end.
content_old: 21 An estate acquired in haste at the outset Will not be blessed in the end.

content: 22 Do not say, “I will requite evil”; Put your hope in the LORD and He will deliver you.
content_old: 22 Do not say, “I will requite evil”; Put your hope in the LORD and He will deliver you.

content: 23 False weights are an abomination to the LORD; Dishonest scales are not right.
content_old: 23 False weights are an abomination to the LORD; Dishonest scales are not right.

content: 24 A man’s steps are decided by the LORD; What does a man know about his own way?
content_old: 24 A man’s steps are decided by the LORD; What does a man know about his own way?

content: 25 It is a snare for a man to pledge a sacred gift rashly And to give thought to his vows only after they have been made.
content_old: 25 It is a snare for a man to pledge a sacred gift rashly And to give thought to his vows only after they have been made.

content: 26 A wise king winnows out the wicked, And turns the wheel upon them.
content_old: 26 A wise king winnows out the wicked, And turns the wheel upon them.

content: 27 The lifebreath of man is the lamp of the LORD Revealing all his inmost parts.
content_old: 27 The lifebreath of man is the lamp of the LORD Revealing all his inmost parts.

content: 28 Faithfulness and loyalty protect the king; He maintains his throne by faithfulness.
content_old: 28 Faithfulness and loyalty protect the king; He maintains his throne by faithfulness.

content: 29 The glory of youths is their strength; The majesty of old men is their gray hair.
content_old: 29 The glory of youths is their strength; The majesty of old men is their gray hair.

content: 1 Like channeled water is the mind of the king in the LORD’s hand; He directs it to whatever He wishes.
content_old: 1 Like channeled water is the mind of the king in the LORD’s hand; He directs it to whatever He wishes.

content: 2 All the ways of a man seem right to him, But the LORD probes the mind.
content_old: 2 All the ways of a man seem right to him, But the LORD probes the mind.

content: 3 To do what is right and just Is more desired by the LORD than sacrifice.
content_old: 3 To do what is right and just Is more desired by the LORD than sacrifice.

content: 4 Haughty looks, a proud heart— The tillage of the wicked is sinful.
content_old: 4 Haughty looks, a proud heart— The tillage of the wicked is sinful.

content: 5 The plans of the diligent make only for gain; All rash haste makes only for loss.
content_old: 5 The plans of the diligent make only for gain; All rash haste makes only for loss.

content: 6 Treasures acquired by a lying tongue Are like driven vapor, heading for extinction.
content_old: 6 Treasures acquired by a lying tongue Are like driven vapor, heading for extinction.

content: 7 The violence of the wicked sweeps them away, For they refuse to act justly.
content_old: 7 The violence of the wicked sweeps them away, For they refuse to act justly.

content: 8 The way of a man may be tortuous and strange, Though his actions are blameless and proper.
content_old: 8 The way of a man may be tortuous and strange, Though his actions are blameless and proper.

content: 9 Dwelling in the corner of a roof is better Than a contentious wife in a spacious house.
content_old: 9 Dwelling in the corner of a roof is better Than a contentious wife in a spacious house.

content: 10 The desire of the wicked is set upon evil; His fellowman finds no favor in his eyes.
content_old: 10 The desire of the wicked is set upon evil; His fellowman finds no favor in his eyes.

content: 11 When a scoffer is punished, the simple man is edified; When a wise man is taught, he gains insight.
content_old: 11 When a scoffer is punished, the simple man is edified; When a wise man is taught, he gains insight.

content: 12 The Righteous One observes the house of the wicked man; He subverts the wicked to their ruin.
content_old: 12 The Righteous One observes the house of the wicked man; He subverts the wicked to their ruin.

content: 13 Who stops his ears at the cry of the wretched, He too will call and not be answered.
content_old: 13 Who stops his ears at the cry of the wretched, He too will call and not be answered.

content: 14 A gift in secret subdues anger, A present in private, fierce rage.
content_old: 14 A gift in secret subdues anger, A present in private, fierce rage.

content: 15 Justice done is a joy to the righteous, To evildoers, ruination.
content_old: 15 Justice done is a joy to the righteous, To evildoers, ruination.

content: 16 A man who strays from the path of prudence Will rest in the company of ghosts.
content_old: 16 A man who strays from the path of prudence Will rest in the company of ghosts.

content: 17 He who loves pleasure comes to want; He who loves wine and oil does not grow rich.
content_old: 17 He who loves pleasure comes to want; He who loves wine and oil does not grow rich.

content: 18 The wicked are the ransom of the righteous; The traitor comes in place of the upright.
content_old: 18 The wicked are the ransom of the righteous; The traitor comes in place of the upright.

content: 19 It is better to live in the desert Than with a contentious, vexatious wife.
content_old: 19 It is better to live in the desert Than with a contentious, vexatious wife.

content: 20 Precious treasure and oil are in the house of the wise man, And a fool of a man will run through them.
content_old: 20 Precious treasure and oil are in the house of the wise man, And a fool of a man will run through them.

content: 21 He who strives to do good and kind deeds Attains life, success, and honor.
content_old: 21 He who strives to do good and kind deeds Attains life, success, and honor.

content: 22 One wise man prevailed over a city of warriors And brought down its mighty stronghold.
content_old: 22 One wise man prevailed over a city of warriors And brought down its mighty stronghold.

content: 23 He who guards his mouth and tongue Guards himself from trouble.
content_old: 23 He who guards his mouth and tongue Guards himself from trouble.

content: 24 The proud, insolent man, scoffer is his name, Acts in a frenzy of insolence.
content_old: 24 The proud, insolent man, scoffer is his name, Acts in a frenzy of insolence.

content: 25 The craving of a lazy man kills him, For his hands refuse to work.
content_old: 25 The craving of a lazy man kills him, For his hands refuse to work.

content: 26 All day long he is seized with craving While the righteous man gives without stint.
content_old: 26 All day long he is seized with craving While the righteous man gives without stint.

content: 27 The sacrifice of the wicked man is an abomination, The more so as he offers it in depravity.
content_old: 27 The sacrifice of the wicked man is an abomination, The more so as he offers it in depravity.

content: 28 A false witness is doomed, But one who really heard will testify with success.
content_old: 28 A false witness is doomed, But one who really heard will testify with success.

content: 29 The wicked man is brazen-faced; The upright man discerns his course.
content_old: 29 The wicked man is brazen-faced; The upright man discerns his course.

content: 30 No wisdom, no prudence, and no counsel Can prevail against the LORD.
content_old: 30 No wisdom, no prudence, and no counsel Can prevail against the LORD.

content: 1 Repute is preferable to great wealth, Grace is better than silver and gold.
content_old: 1 Repute is preferable to great wealth, Grace is better than silver and gold.

content: 2 Rich man and poor man meet; The LORD made them both.
content_old: 2 Rich man and poor man meet; The LORD made them both.

content: 3 The shrewd man saw trouble and took cover; The simple kept going and paid the penalty.
content_old: 3 The shrewd man saw trouble and took cover; The simple kept going and paid the penalty.

content: 4 The effect of humility is fear of the LORD, Wealth, honor, and life.
content_old: 4 The effect of humility is fear of the LORD, Wealth, honor, and life.

content: 5 Thorns and snares are in the path of the crooked; He who values his life will keep far from them.
content_old: 5 Thorns and snares are in the path of the crooked; He who values his life will keep far from them.

content: 6 Train a lad in the way he ought to go; He will not swerve from it even in old age.
content_old: 6 Train a lad in the way he ought to go; He will not swerve from it even in old age.

content: 7 The rich rule the poor, And the borrower is a slave to the lender.
content_old: 7 The rich rule the poor, And the borrower is a slave to the lender.

content: 8 He who sows injustice shall reap misfortune; His rod of wrath shall fail.
content_old: 8 He who sows injustice shall reap misfortune; His rod of wrath shall fail.

content: 9 The generous man is blessed, For he gives of his bread to the poor.
content_old: 9 The generous man is blessed, For he gives of his bread to the poor.

content: 10 Expel the scoffer and contention departs, Quarrel and contumely cease.
content_old: 10 Expel the scoffer and contention departs, Quarrel and contumely cease.

content: 11 A pure-hearted friend, His speech is gracious; He has the king for his companion.
content_old: 11 A pure-hearted friend, His speech is gracious; He has the king for his companion.

content: 12 The eyes of the LORD watch the wise man; He subverts the words of the treacherous.
content_old: 12 The eyes of the LORD watch the wise man; He subverts the words of the treacherous.

content: 13 The lazy man says, “There’s a lion in the street; I shall be killed if I step outside.”
content_old: 13 The lazy man says, “There’s a lion in the street; I shall be killed if I step outside.”

content: 14 The mouth of a forbidden woman is a deep pit; He who is doomed by the LORD falls into it.
content_old: 14 The mouth of a forbidden woman is a deep pit; He who is doomed by the LORD falls into it.

content: 15 If folly settles in the heart of a lad, The rod of discipline will remove it.
content_old: 15 If folly settles in the heart of a lad, The rod of discipline will remove it.

content: 16 To profit by withholding what is due to the poor Is like making gifts to the rich—pure loss.
content_old: 16 To profit by withholding what is due to the poor Is like making gifts to the rich—pure loss.

content: 17 Incline your ear and listen to the words of the sages; Pay attention to my wisdom.
content_old: 17 Incline your ear and listen to the words of the sages; Pay attention to my wisdom.

content: 18 It is good that you store them inside you, And that all of them be constantly on your lips,
content_old: 18 It is good that you store them inside you, And that all of them be constantly on your lips,

content: 19 That you may put your trust in the LORD. I let you know today—yes, you—
content_old: 19 That you may put your trust in the LORD. I let you know today—yes, you—

content: 20 Indeed, I wrote down for you a threefold lore, Wise counsel,
content_old: 20 Indeed, I wrote down for you a threefold lore, Wise counsel,

content: 21 To let you know truly reliable words, That you may give a faithful reply to him who sent you.
content_old: 21 To let you know truly reliable words, That you may give a faithful reply to him who sent you.

content: 22 Do not rob the wretched because he is wretched; Do not crush the poor man in the gate;
content_old: 22 Do not rob the wretched because he is wretched; Do not crush the poor man in the gate;

content: 23 For the LORD will take up their cause And despoil those who despoil them of life.
content_old: 23 For the LORD will take up their cause And despoil those who despoil them of life.

content: 24 Do not associate with an irascible man, Or go about with one who is hot-tempered,
content_old: 24 Do not associate with an irascible man, Or go about with one who is hot-tempered,

content: 25 Lest you learn his ways And find yourself ensnared.
content_old: 25 Lest you learn his ways And find yourself ensnared.

content: 26 Do not be one of those who give their hand, Who stand surety for debts,
content_old: 26 Do not be one of those who give their hand, Who stand surety for debts,

content: 27 Lest your bed be taken from under you When you have no money to pay.
content_old: 27 Lest your bed be taken from under you When you have no money to pay.

content: 28 Do not remove the ancient boundary stone That your ancestors set up.
content_old: 28 Do not remove the ancient boundary stone That your ancestors set up.

content: 1 When you sit down to dine with a ruler, Consider well who is before you.
content_old: 1 When you sit down to dine with a ruler, Consider well who is before you.

content: 2 Thrust a knife into your gullet If you have a large appetite.
content_old: 2 Thrust a knife into your gullet If you have a large appetite.

content: 3 Do not crave for his dainties, For they are counterfeit food.
content_old: 3 Do not crave for his dainties, For they are counterfeit food.

content: 4 Do not toil to gain wealth; Have the sense to desist.
content_old: 4 Do not toil to gain wealth; Have the sense to desist.

content: 5 You see it, then it is gone; It grows wings and flies away, Like an eagle, heavenward.
content_old: 5 You see it, then it is gone; It grows wings and flies away, Like an eagle, heavenward.

content: 6 Do not eat of a stingy man’s food; Do not crave for his dainties;
content_old: 6 Do not eat of a stingy man’s food; Do not crave for his dainties;

content: 7 He is like one keeping accounts; “Eat and drink,” he says to you, But he does not really mean it.
content_old: 7 He is like one keeping accounts; “Eat and drink,” he says to you, But he does not really mean it.

content: 8 The morsel you eat you will vomit; You will waste your courteous words.
content_old: 8 The morsel you eat you will vomit; You will waste your courteous words.

content: 9 Do not speak to a dullard, For he will disdain your sensible words.
content_old: 9 Do not speak to a dullard, For he will disdain your sensible words.

content: 10 Do not remove ancient boundary stones; Do not encroach upon the field of orphans,
content_old: 10 Do not remove ancient boundary stones; Do not encroach upon the field of orphans,

content: 11 For they have a mighty Kinsman, And He will surely take up their cause with you.
content_old: 11 For they have a mighty Kinsman, And He will surely take up their cause with you.

content: 12 Apply your mind to discipline And your ears to wise sayings.
content_old: 12 Apply your mind to discipline And your ears to wise sayings.

content: 13 Do not withhold discipline from a child; If you beat him with a rod he will not die.
content_old: 13 Do not withhold discipline from a child; If you beat him with a rod he will not die.

content: 14 Beat him with a rod And you will save him from the grave.
content_old: 14 Beat him with a rod And you will save him from the grave.

content: 15 My son, if your mind gets wisdom, My mind, too, will be gladdened.
content_old: 15 My son, if your mind gets wisdom, My mind, too, will be gladdened.

content: 16 I shall rejoice with all my heart When your lips speak right things.
content_old: 16 I shall rejoice with all my heart When your lips speak right things.

content: 17 Do not envy sinners in your heart, But only God-fearing men, at all times,
content_old: 17 Do not envy sinners in your heart, But only God-fearing men, at all times,

content: 18 For then you will have a future, And your hope will never fail.
content_old: 18 For then you will have a future, And your hope will never fail.

content: 19 Listen, my son, and get wisdom; Lead your mind in a proper path.
content_old: 19 Listen, my son, and get wisdom; Lead your mind in a proper path.

content: 20 Do not be of those who guzzle wine, Or glut themselves on meat;
content_old: 20 Do not be of those who guzzle wine, Or glut themselves on meat;

content: 21 For guzzlers and gluttons will be impoverished, And drowsing will clothe you in tatters.
content_old: 21 For guzzlers and gluttons will be impoverished, And drowsing will clothe you in tatters.

content: 22 Listen to your father who begot you; Do not disdain your mother when she is old.
content_old: 22 Listen to your father who begot you; Do not disdain your mother when she is old.

content: 23 Buy truth and never sell it, And wisdom, discipline, and understanding.
content_old: 23 Buy truth and never sell it, And wisdom, discipline, and understanding.

content: 24 The father of a righteous man will exult; He who begets a wise son will rejoice in him.
content_old: 24 The father of a righteous man will exult; He who begets a wise son will rejoice in him.

content: 25 Your father and mother will rejoice; She who bore you will exult.
content_old: 25 Your father and mother will rejoice; She who bore you will exult.

content: 26 Give your mind to me, my son; Let your eyes watch my ways.
content_old: 26 Give your mind to me, my son; Let your eyes watch my ways.

content: 27 A harlot is a deep pit; A forbidden woman is a narrow well.
content_old: 27 A harlot is a deep pit; A forbidden woman is a narrow well.

content: 28 She too lies in wait as if for prey, And destroys the unfaithful among men.
content_old: 28 She too lies in wait as if for prey, And destroys the unfaithful among men.

content: 29 Who cries, “Woe!” who, “Alas!”; Who has quarrels, who complaints; Who has wounds without cause; Who has bleary eyes?
content_old: 29 Who cries, “Woe!” who, “Alas!”; Who has quarrels, who complaints; Who has wounds without cause; Who has bleary eyes?

content: 30 Those whom wine keeps till the small hours, Those who gather to drain the cups.
content_old: 30 Those whom wine keeps till the small hours, Those who gather to drain the cups.

content: 31 Do not ogle that red wine As it lends its color to the cup, As it flows on smoothly;
content_old: 31 Do not ogle that red wine As it lends its color to the cup, As it flows on smoothly;

content: 32 In the end, it bites like a snake; It spits like a basilisk.
content_old: 32 In the end, it bites like a snake; It spits like a basilisk.

content: 33 Your eyes will see strange sights; Your heart will speak distorted things.
content_old: 33 Your eyes will see strange sights; Your heart will speak distorted things.

content: 34 You will be like one lying in bed on high seas, Like one lying on top of the rigging.
content_old: 34 You will be like one lying in bed on high seas, Like one lying on top of the rigging.

content: 1 Do not envy evil men; Do not desire to be with them;
content_old: 1 Do not envy evil men; Do not desire to be with them;

content: 2 For their hearts talk violence, And their lips speak mischief.
content_old: 2 For their hearts talk violence, And their lips speak mischief.

content: 3 A house is built by wisdom, And is established by understanding;
content_old: 3 A house is built by wisdom, And is established by understanding;

content: 4 By knowledge are its rooms filled With all precious and beautiful things.
content_old: 4 By knowledge are its rooms filled With all precious and beautiful things.

content: 5 A wise man is strength; A knowledgeable man exerts power;
content_old: 5 A wise man is strength; A knowledgeable man exerts power;

content: 6 For by stratagems you wage war, And victory comes with much planning.
content_old: 6 For by stratagems you wage war, And victory comes with much planning.

content: 7 Wisdom is too lofty for a fool; He does not open his mouth in the gate.
content_old: 7 Wisdom is too lofty for a fool; He does not open his mouth in the gate.

content: 8 He who lays plans to do harm Is called by men a schemer.
content_old: 8 He who lays plans to do harm Is called by men a schemer.

content: 9 The schemes of folly are sin, And a scoffer is an abomination to men.
content_old: 9 The schemes of folly are sin, And a scoffer is an abomination to men.

content: 10 If you showed yourself slack in time of trouble, Wanting in power,
content_old: 10 If you showed yourself slack in time of trouble, Wanting in power,

content: 11 If you refrained from rescuing those taken off to death, Those condemned to slaughter—
content_old: 11 If you refrained from rescuing those taken off to death, Those condemned to slaughter—

content: 12 If you say, “We knew nothing of it,” Surely He who fathoms hearts will discern, He who watches over your life will know it, And He will pay each man as he deserves.
content_old: 12 If you say, “We knew nothing of it,” Surely He who fathoms hearts will discern, He who watches over your life will know it, And He will pay each man as he deserves.

content: 13 My son, eat honey, for it is good; Let its sweet drops be on your palate.
content_old: 13 My son, eat honey, for it is good; Let its sweet drops be on your palate.

content: 14 Know: such is wisdom for your soul; If you attain it, there is a future; Your hope will not be cut off.
content_old: 14 Know: such is wisdom for your soul; If you attain it, there is a future; Your hope will not be cut off.

content: 15 Wicked man! Do not lurk by the home of the righteous man; Do no violence to his dwelling.
content_old: 15 Wicked man! Do not lurk by the home of the righteous man; Do no violence to his dwelling.

content: 16 Seven times the righteous man falls and gets up, While the wicked are tripped by one misfortune.
content_old: 16 Seven times the righteous man falls and gets up, While the wicked are tripped by one misfortune.

content: 17 If your enemy falls, do not exult; If he trips, let your heart not rejoice,
content_old: 17 If your enemy falls, do not exult; If he trips, let your heart not rejoice,

content: 18 Lest the LORD see it and be displeased, And avert His wrath from him.
content_old: 18 Lest the LORD see it and be displeased, And avert His wrath from him.

content: 19 Do not be vexed by evildoers; Do not be incensed by the wicked;
content_old: 19 Do not be vexed by evildoers; Do not be incensed by the wicked;

content: 20 For there is no future for the evil man; The lamp of the wicked goes out.
content_old: 20 For there is no future for the evil man; The lamp of the wicked goes out.

content: 21 Fear the LORD, my son, and the king, And do not mix with dissenters,
content_old: 21 Fear the LORD, my son, and the king, And do not mix with dissenters,

content: 22 For disaster comes from them suddenly; The doom both decree who can foreknow?
content_old: 22 For disaster comes from them suddenly; The doom both decree who can foreknow?

content: 23 These also are by the sages: It is not right to be partial in judgment.
content_old: 23 These also are by the sages: It is not right to be partial in judgment.

content: 24 He who says to the guilty, “You are innocent,” Shall be cursed by peoples, Damned by nations;
content_old: 24 He who says to the guilty, “You are innocent,” Shall be cursed by peoples, Damned by nations;

content: 25 But it shall go well with them who decide justly; Blessings of good things will light upon them.
content_old: 25 But it shall go well with them who decide justly; Blessings of good things will light upon them.

content: 26 Giving a straightforward reply Is like giving a kiss.
content_old: 26 Giving a straightforward reply Is like giving a kiss.

content: 27 Put your external affairs in order, Get ready what you have in the field, Then build yourself a home.
content_old: 27 Put your external affairs in order, Get ready what you have in the field, Then build yourself a home.

content: 28 Do not be a witness against your fellow without good cause; Would you mislead with your speech?
content_old: 28 Do not be a witness against your fellow without good cause; Would you mislead with your speech?

content: 29 Do not say, “I will do to him what he did to me; I will pay the man what he deserves.”
content_old: 29 Do not say, “I will do to him what he did to me; I will pay the man what he deserves.”

content: 30 I passed by the field of a lazy man, By the vineyard of a man lacking sense.
content_old: 30 I passed by the field of a lazy man, By the vineyard of a man lacking sense.

content: 31 It was all overgrown with thorns; Its surface was covered with chickweed, And its stone fence lay in ruins.
content_old: 31 It was all overgrown with thorns; Its surface was covered with chickweed, And its stone fence lay in ruins.

content: 32 I observed and took it to heart; I saw it and learned a lesson.
content_old: 32 I observed and took it to heart; I saw it and learned a lesson.

content: 33 A bit more sleep, a bit more slumber, A bit more hugging yourself in bed,
content_old: 33 A bit more sleep, a bit more slumber, A bit more hugging yourself in bed,

content: 1 These too are proverbs of Solomon, which the men of King Hezekiah of Judah copied:
content_old: 1 These too are proverbs of Solomon, which the men of King Hezekiah of Judah copied:

content: 2 It is the glory of God to conceal a matter, And the glory of a king to plumb a matter.
content_old: 2 It is the glory of God to conceal a matter, And the glory of a king to plumb a matter.

content: 3 Like the heavens in their height, like the earth in its depth, Is the mind of kings—unfathomable.
content_old: 3 Like the heavens in their height, like the earth in its depth, Is the mind of kings—unfathomable.

content: 4 The dross having been separated from the silver, A vessel emerged for the smith.
content_old: 4 The dross having been separated from the silver, A vessel emerged for the smith.

content: 5 Remove the wicked from the king’s presence, And his throne will be established in justice.
content_old: 5 Remove the wicked from the king’s presence, And his throne will be established in justice.

content: 6 Do not exalt yourself in the king’s presence; Do not stand in the place of nobles.
content_old: 6 Do not exalt yourself in the king’s presence; Do not stand in the place of nobles.

content: 7 For it is better to be told, “Step up here,” Than to be degraded in the presence of the great. Do not let what your eyes have seen
content_old: 7 For it is better to be told, “Step up here,” Than to be degraded in the presence of the great. Do not let what your eyes have seen

content: 8 Be vented rashly in a quarrel; Think of what it will effect in the end, When your fellow puts you to shame.
content_old: 8 Be vented rashly in a quarrel; Think of what it will effect in the end, When your fellow puts you to shame.

content: 9 Defend your right against your fellow, But do not give away the secrets of another,
content_old: 9 Defend your right against your fellow, But do not give away the secrets of another,

content: 10 Lest he who hears it reproach you, And your bad repute never end.
content_old: 10 Lest he who hears it reproach you, And your bad repute never end.

content: 11 Like golden apples in silver showpieces Is a phrase well turned.
content_old: 11 Like golden apples in silver showpieces Is a phrase well turned.

content: 12 Like a ring of gold, a golden ornament, Is a wise man’s reproof in a receptive ear.
content_old: 12 Like a ring of gold, a golden ornament, Is a wise man’s reproof in a receptive ear.

content: 13 Like the coldness of snow at harvesttime Is a trusty messenger to those who send him; He lifts his master’s spirits.
content_old: 13 Like the coldness of snow at harvesttime Is a trusty messenger to those who send him; He lifts his master’s spirits.

content: 14 Like clouds, wind—but no rain— Is one who boasts of gifts not given.
content_old: 14 Like clouds, wind—but no rain— Is one who boasts of gifts not given.

content: 15 Through forbearance a ruler may be won over; A gentle tongue can break bones.
content_old: 15 Through forbearance a ruler may be won over; A gentle tongue can break bones.

content: 16 If you find honey, eat only what you need, Lest, surfeiting yourself, you throw it up.
content_old: 16 If you find honey, eat only what you need, Lest, surfeiting yourself, you throw it up.

content: 17 Visit your neighbor sparingly, Lest he have his surfeit of you and loathe you.
content_old: 17 Visit your neighbor sparingly, Lest he have his surfeit of you and loathe you.

content: 18 Like a club, a sword, a sharpened arrow, Is a man who testifies falsely against his fellow.
content_old: 18 Like a club, a sword, a sharpened arrow, Is a man who testifies falsely against his fellow.

content: 19 Like a loose tooth and an unsteady leg, Is a treacherous support in time of trouble.
content_old: 19 Like a loose tooth and an unsteady leg, Is a treacherous support in time of trouble.

content: 20 Disrobing on a chilly day, Like vinegar on natron, Is one who sings songs to a sorrowful soul.
content_old: 20 Disrobing on a chilly day, Like vinegar on natron, Is one who sings songs to a sorrowful soul.

content: 21 If your enemy is hungry, give him bread to eat; If he is thirsty, give him water to drink.
content_old: 21 If your enemy is hungry, give him bread to eat; If he is thirsty, give him water to drink.

content: 22 You will be heaping live coals on his head, And the LORD will reward you.
content_old: 22 You will be heaping live coals on his head, And the LORD will reward you.

content: 23 A north wind produces rain, And whispered words, a glowering face.
content_old: 23 A north wind produces rain, And whispered words, a glowering face.

content: 24 Dwelling in the corner of a roof is better Than a contentious woman in a spacious house.
content_old: 24 Dwelling in the corner of a roof is better Than a contentious woman in a spacious house.

content: 25 Like cold water to a parched throat Is good news from a distant land.
content_old: 25 Like cold water to a parched throat Is good news from a distant land.

content: 26 Like a muddied spring, a ruined fountain, Is a righteous man fallen before a wicked one.
content_old: 26 Like a muddied spring, a ruined fountain, Is a righteous man fallen before a wicked one.

content: 27 It is not good to eat much honey, Nor is it honorable to search for honor.
content_old: 27 It is not good to eat much honey, Nor is it honorable to search for honor.

content: 1 Like snow in summer and rain at harvesttime, So honor is not fitting for a dullard.
content_old: 1 Like snow in summer and rain at harvesttime, So honor is not fitting for a dullard.

content: 2 As a sparrow must flit and a swallow fly, So a gratuitous curse must backfire.
content_old: 2 As a sparrow must flit and a swallow fly, So a gratuitous curse must backfire.

content: 3 A whip for a horse and a bridle for a donkey, And a rod for the back of dullards.
content_old: 3 A whip for a horse and a bridle for a donkey, And a rod for the back of dullards.

content: 4 Do not answer a dullard in accord with his folly, Else you will become like him.
content_old: 4 Do not answer a dullard in accord with his folly, Else you will become like him.

content: 5 Answer a dullard in accord with his folly, Else he will think himself wise.
content_old: 5 Answer a dullard in accord with his folly, Else he will think himself wise.

content: 6 He who sends a message by a dullard Will wear out legs and must put up with lawlessness.
content_old: 6 He who sends a message by a dullard Will wear out legs and must put up with lawlessness.

content: 7 As legs hang limp on a cripple, So is a proverb in the mouth of dullards.
content_old: 7 As legs hang limp on a cripple, So is a proverb in the mouth of dullards.

content: 8 Like a pebble in a sling, So is paying honor to a dullard.
content_old: 8 Like a pebble in a sling, So is paying honor to a dullard.

content: 9 As a thorn comes to the hand of a drunkard, So a proverb to the mouth of a dullard.
content_old: 9 As a thorn comes to the hand of a drunkard, So a proverb to the mouth of a dullard.

content: 10 A master can produce anything, But he who hires a dullard is as one who hires transients.
content_old: 10 A master can produce anything, But he who hires a dullard is as one who hires transients.

content: 11 As a dog returns to his vomit, So a dullard repeats his folly.
content_old: 11 As a dog returns to his vomit, So a dullard repeats his folly.

content: 12 If you see a man who thinks himself wise, There is more hope for a dullard than for him.
content_old: 12 If you see a man who thinks himself wise, There is more hope for a dullard than for him.

content: 13 A lazy man says, “There’s a cub on the road, a lion in the squares.”
content_old: 13 A lazy man says, “There’s a cub on the road, a lion in the squares.”

content: 14 The door turns on its hinge, And the lazy man on his bed.
content_old: 14 The door turns on its hinge, And the lazy man on his bed.

content: 15 The lazy man buries his hand in the bowl; He will not even bring it to his mouth.
content_old: 15 The lazy man buries his hand in the bowl; He will not even bring it to his mouth.

content: 16 The lazy man thinks himself wiser Than seven men who give good advice.
content_old: 16 The lazy man thinks himself wiser Than seven men who give good advice.

content: 17 A passerby who gets embroiled in someone else’s quarrel Is like one who seizes a dog by its ears.
content_old: 17 A passerby who gets embroiled in someone else’s quarrel Is like one who seizes a dog by its ears.

content: 18 Like a madman scattering deadly firebrands, arrows,
content_old: 18 Like a madman scattering deadly firebrands, arrows,

content: 19 Is one who cheats his fellow and says, “I was only joking.”
content_old: 19 Is one who cheats his fellow and says, “I was only joking.”

content: 20 For lack of wood a fire goes out, And without a querulous man contention is stilled.
content_old: 20 For lack of wood a fire goes out, And without a querulous man contention is stilled.

content: 21 Charcoal for embers and wood for a fire And a contentious man for kindling strife.
content_old: 21 Charcoal for embers and wood for a fire And a contentious man for kindling strife.

content: 22 The words of a querulous man are bruising; They penetrate one’s inmost parts.
content_old: 22 The words of a querulous man are bruising; They penetrate one’s inmost parts.

content: 23 Base silver laid over earthenware Are ardent lips with an evil mind.
content_old: 23 Base silver laid over earthenware Are ardent lips with an evil mind.

content: 24 An enemy dissembles with his speech, Inwardly he harbors deceit.
content_old: 24 An enemy dissembles with his speech, Inwardly he harbors deceit.

content: 25 Though he be fair-spoken do not trust him, For seven abominations are in his mind.
content_old: 25 Though he be fair-spoken do not trust him, For seven abominations are in his mind.

content: 26 His hatred may be concealed by dissimulation, But his evil will be exposed to public view.
content_old: 26 His hatred may be concealed by dissimulation, But his evil will be exposed to public view.

content: 27 He who digs a pit will fall in it, And whoever rolls a stone, it will roll back on him.
content_old: 27 He who digs a pit will fall in it, And whoever rolls a stone, it will roll back on him.

content: 1 Do not boast of tomorrow, For you do not know what the day will bring.
content_old: 1 Do not boast of tomorrow, For you do not know what the day will bring.

content: 2 Let the mouth of another praise you, not yours, The lips of a stranger, not your own.
content_old: 2 Let the mouth of another praise you, not yours, The lips of a stranger, not your own.

content: 3 A stone has weight, sand is heavy, But a fool’s vexation outweighs them both.
content_old: 3 A stone has weight, sand is heavy, But a fool’s vexation outweighs them both.

content: 4 There is the cruelty of fury, the overflowing of anger, But who can withstand jealousy?
content_old: 4 There is the cruelty of fury, the overflowing of anger, But who can withstand jealousy?

content: 5 Open reproof is better than concealed love.
content_old: 5 Open reproof is better than concealed love.

content: 6 Wounds by a loved one are long lasting; The kisses of an enemy are profuse.
content_old: 6 Wounds by a loved one are long lasting; The kisses of an enemy are profuse.

content: 7 A sated person disdains honey, But to a hungry man anything bitter seems sweet.
content_old: 7 A sated person disdains honey, But to a hungry man anything bitter seems sweet.

content: 8 Like a sparrow wandering from its nest Is a man who wanders from his home.
content_old: 8 Like a sparrow wandering from its nest Is a man who wanders from his home.

content: 9 Oil and incense gladden the heart, And the sweetness of a friend is better than one’s own counsel.
content_old: 9 Oil and incense gladden the heart, And the sweetness of a friend is better than one’s own counsel.

content: 10 Do not desert your friend and your father’s friend; Do not enter your brother’s house in your time of misfortune; A close neighbor is better than a distant brother.
content_old: 10 Do not desert your friend and your father’s friend; Do not enter your brother’s house in your time of misfortune; A close neighbor is better than a distant brother.

content: 11 Get wisdom, my son, and gladden my heart, That I may have what to answer those who taunt me.
content_old: 11 Get wisdom, my son, and gladden my heart, That I may have what to answer those who taunt me.

content: 12 The shrewd man saw trouble and took cover; The simple kept going and paid the penalty.
content_old: 12 The shrewd man saw trouble and took cover; The simple kept going and paid the penalty.

content: 13 Seize his garment, for he stood surety for another; Take it as a pledge, for he stood surety for an unfamiliar woman.
content_old: 13 Seize his garment, for he stood surety for another; Take it as a pledge, for he stood surety for an unfamiliar woman.

content: 14 He who greets his fellow loudly early in the morning Shall have it reckoned to him as a curse.
content_old: 14 He who greets his fellow loudly early in the morning Shall have it reckoned to him as a curse.

content: 15 An endless dripping on a rainy day And a contentious wife are alike;
content_old: 15 An endless dripping on a rainy day And a contentious wife are alike;

content: 16 As soon repress her as repress the wind, Or declare one’s right hand to be oil.
content_old: 16 As soon repress her as repress the wind, Or declare one’s right hand to be oil.

content: 17 As iron sharpens iron So a man sharpens the wit of his friend.
content_old: 17 As iron sharpens iron So a man sharpens the wit of his friend.

content: 18 He who tends a fig tree will enjoy its fruit, And he who cares for his master will be honored.
content_old: 18 He who tends a fig tree will enjoy its fruit, And he who cares for his master will be honored.

content: 19 As face answers to face in water, So does one man’s heart to another.
content_old: 19 As face answers to face in water, So does one man’s heart to another.

content: 20 Sheol and Abaddon cannot be satisfied, Nor can the eyes of man be satisfied.
content_old: 20 Sheol and Abaddon cannot be satisfied, Nor can the eyes of man be satisfied.

content: 21 For silver—the crucible, for gold—the furnace, And a man is tested by his praise.
content_old: 21 For silver—the crucible, for gold—the furnace, And a man is tested by his praise.

content: 22 Even if you pound the fool in a mortar With a pestle along with grain, His folly will not leave him.
content_old: 22 Even if you pound the fool in a mortar With a pestle along with grain, His folly will not leave him.

content: 23 Mind well the looks of your flock; Pay attention to your herds;
content_old: 23 Mind well the looks of your flock; Pay attention to your herds;

content: 24 For property does not last forever, Or a crown for all generations.
content_old: 24 For property does not last forever, Or a crown for all generations.

content: 25 Grass vanishes, new grass appears, And the herbage of the hills is gathered in.
content_old: 25 Grass vanishes, new grass appears, And the herbage of the hills is gathered in.

content: 26 The lambs will provide you with clothing, The he-goats, the price of a field.
content_old: 26 The lambs will provide you with clothing, The he-goats, the price of a field.

content: 1 The wicked flee though no one gives chase, But the righteous are as confident as a lion.
content_old: 1 The wicked flee though no one gives chase, But the righteous are as confident as a lion.

content: 2 When there is rebellion in the land, many are its rulers; But with a man who has understanding and knowledge, stability will last.
content_old: 2 When there is rebellion in the land, many are its rulers; But with a man who has understanding and knowledge, stability will last.

content: 3 A poor man who withholds what is due to the wretched Is like a destructive rain that leaves no food.
content_old: 3 A poor man who withholds what is due to the wretched Is like a destructive rain that leaves no food.

content: 4 Those who forsake instruction praise the wicked, But those who heed instruction fight them.
content_old: 4 Those who forsake instruction praise the wicked, But those who heed instruction fight them.

content: 5 Evil men cannot discern judgment, But those who seek the LORD discern all things.
content_old: 5 Evil men cannot discern judgment, But those who seek the LORD discern all things.

content: 6 Better is a poor man who lives blamelessly Than a rich man whose ways are crooked.
content_old: 6 Better is a poor man who lives blamelessly Than a rich man whose ways are crooked.

content: 7 An intelligent son heeds instruction, But he who keeps company with gluttons disgraces his father.
content_old: 7 An intelligent son heeds instruction, But he who keeps company with gluttons disgraces his father.

content: 8 He who increases his wealth by loans at discount or interest Amasses it for one who is generous to the poor.
content_old: 8 He who increases his wealth by loans at discount or interest Amasses it for one who is generous to the poor.

content: 9 He who turns a deaf ear to instruction— His prayer is an abomination.
content_old: 9 He who turns a deaf ear to instruction— His prayer is an abomination.

content: 10 He who misleads the upright into an evil course Will fall into his own pit, But the blameless will prosper.
content_old: 10 He who misleads the upright into an evil course Will fall into his own pit, But the blameless will prosper.

content: 11 A rich man is clever in his own eyes, But a perceptive poor man can see through him.
content_old: 11 A rich man is clever in his own eyes, But a perceptive poor man can see through him.

content: 12 When the righteous exult there is great glory, But when the wicked rise up men make themselves scarce.
content_old: 12 When the righteous exult there is great glory, But when the wicked rise up men make themselves scarce.

content: 13 He who covers up his faults will not succeed; He who confesses and gives them up will find mercy.
content_old: 13 He who covers up his faults will not succeed; He who confesses and gives them up will find mercy.

content: 14 Happy is the man who is anxious always, But he who hardens his heart falls into misfortune.
content_old: 14 Happy is the man who is anxious always, But he who hardens his heart falls into misfortune.

content: 15 A roaring lion and a prowling bear Is a wicked man ruling a helpless people.
content_old: 15 A roaring lion and a prowling bear Is a wicked man ruling a helpless people.

content: 16 A prince who lacks understanding is very oppressive; He who spurns ill-gotten gains will live long.
content_old: 16 A prince who lacks understanding is very oppressive; He who spurns ill-gotten gains will live long.

content: 17 A man oppressed by bloodguilt will flee to a pit; Let none give him support.
content_old: 17 A man oppressed by bloodguilt will flee to a pit; Let none give him support.

content: 18 He who lives blamelessly will be delivered, But he who is crooked in his ways will fall all at once.
content_old: 18 He who lives blamelessly will be delivered, But he who is crooked in his ways will fall all at once.

content: 19 He who tills his land will have food in plenty, But he who pursues vanities will have poverty in plenty.
content_old: 19 He who tills his land will have food in plenty, But he who pursues vanities will have poverty in plenty.

content: 20 A dependable man will receive many blessings, But one in a hurry to get rich will not go unpunished.
content_old: 20 A dependable man will receive many blessings, But one in a hurry to get rich will not go unpunished.

content: 21 To be partial is not right; A man may do wrong for a piece of bread.
content_old: 21 To be partial is not right; A man may do wrong for a piece of bread.

content: 22 A miserly man runs after wealth; He does not realize that loss will overtake it.
content_old: 22 A miserly man runs after wealth; He does not realize that loss will overtake it.

content: 23 He who reproves a man will in the end Find more favor than he who flatters him.
content_old: 23 He who reproves a man will in the end Find more favor than he who flatters him.

content: 24 He who robs his father and mother and says, “It is no offense,” Is a companion to vandals.
content_old: 24 He who robs his father and mother and says, “It is no offense,” Is a companion to vandals.

content: 25 A greedy man provokes quarrels, But he who trusts the LORD shall enjoy prosperity.
content_old: 25 A greedy man provokes quarrels, But he who trusts the LORD shall enjoy prosperity.

content: 26 He who trusts his own instinct is a dullard, But he who lives by wisdom shall escape.
content_old: 26 He who trusts his own instinct is a dullard, But he who lives by wisdom shall escape.

content: 27 He who gives to the poor will not be in want, But he who shuts his eyes will be roundly cursed.
content_old: 27 He who gives to the poor will not be in want, But he who shuts his eyes will be roundly cursed.

content: 1 One oft reproved may become stiff-necked, But he will be suddenly broken beyond repair.
content_old: 1 One oft reproved may become stiff-necked, But he will be suddenly broken beyond repair.

content: 2 When the righteous become great the people rejoice, But when the wicked dominate the people groan.
content_old: 2 When the righteous become great the people rejoice, But when the wicked dominate the people groan.

content: 3 A man who loves wisdom brings joy to his father, But he who keeps company with harlots will lose his wealth.
content_old: 3 A man who loves wisdom brings joy to his father, But he who keeps company with harlots will lose his wealth.

content: 4 By justice a king sustains the land, But a fraudulent man tears it down.
content_old: 4 By justice a king sustains the land, But a fraudulent man tears it down.

content: 5 A man who flatters his fellow Spreads a net for his feet.
content_old: 5 A man who flatters his fellow Spreads a net for his feet.

content: 6 An evil man’s offenses are a trap for himself, But the righteous sing out joyously.
content_old: 6 An evil man’s offenses are a trap for himself, But the righteous sing out joyously.

content: 7 A righteous man is concerned with the cause of the wretched; A wicked man cannot understand such concern.
content_old: 7 A righteous man is concerned with the cause of the wretched; A wicked man cannot understand such concern.

content: 8 Scoffers inflame a city, But the wise allay anger.
content_old: 8 Scoffers inflame a city, But the wise allay anger.

content: 9 When a wise man enters into litigation with a fool There is ranting and ridicule, but no satisfaction.
content_old: 9 When a wise man enters into litigation with a fool There is ranting and ridicule, but no satisfaction.

content: 10 Bloodthirsty men detest the blameless, But the upright seek them out.
content_old: 10 Bloodthirsty men detest the blameless, But the upright seek them out.

content: 11 A dullard vents all his rage, But a wise man calms it down.
content_old: 11 A dullard vents all his rage, But a wise man calms it down.

content: 12 A ruler who listens to lies, All his ministers will be wicked.
content_old: 12 A ruler who listens to lies, All his ministers will be wicked.

content: 13 A poor man and a fraudulent man meet; The LORD gives luster to the eyes of both.
content_old: 13 A poor man and a fraudulent man meet; The LORD gives luster to the eyes of both.

content: 14 A king who judges the wretched honestly, His throne will be established forever.
content_old: 14 A king who judges the wretched honestly, His throne will be established forever.

content: 15 Rod and reproof produce wisdom, But a lad out of control is a disgrace to his mother.
content_old: 15 Rod and reproof produce wisdom, But a lad out of control is a disgrace to his mother.

content: 16 When the wicked increase, offenses increase, But the righteous will see their downfall.
content_old: 16 When the wicked increase, offenses increase, But the righteous will see their downfall.

content: 17 Discipline your son and he will give you peace; He will gratify you with dainties.
content_old: 17 Discipline your son and he will give you peace; He will gratify you with dainties.

content: 18 For lack of vision a people lose restraint, But happy is he who heeds instruction.
content_old: 18 For lack of vision a people lose restraint, But happy is he who heeds instruction.

content: 19 A slave cannot be disciplined by words; Though he may comprehend, he does not respond.
content_old: 19 A slave cannot be disciplined by words; Though he may comprehend, he does not respond.

content: 20 If you see a man hasty in speech, There is more hope for a fool than for him.
content_old: 20 If you see a man hasty in speech, There is more hope for a fool than for him.

content: 21 A slave pampered from youth Will come to a bad end.
content_old: 21 A slave pampered from youth Will come to a bad end.

content: 22 An angry man provokes a quarrel; A hot-tempered man commits many offenses.
content_old: 22 An angry man provokes a quarrel; A hot-tempered man commits many offenses.

content: 23 A man’s pride will humiliate him, But a humble man will obtain honor.
content_old: 23 A man’s pride will humiliate him, But a humble man will obtain honor.

content: 24 He who shares with a thief is his own enemy; He hears the imprecation and does not tell.
content_old: 24 He who shares with a thief is his own enemy; He hears the imprecation and does not tell.

content: 25 A man’s fears become a trap for him, But he who trusts in the LORD shall be safeguarded.
content_old: 25 A man’s fears become a trap for him, But he who trusts in the LORD shall be safeguarded.

content: 26 Many seek audience with a ruler, But it is from the LORD that a man gets justice.
content_old: 26 Many seek audience with a ruler, But it is from the LORD that a man gets justice.

content: 1 The words of Agur son of Jakeh, Massa; The speech of the man to Ithiel, to Ithiel and Ucal:
content_old: 1 The words of Agur son of Jakeh, Massa; The speech of the man to Ithiel, to Ithiel and Ucal:

content: 2 I am brutish, less than a man; I lack common sense.
content_old: 2 I am brutish, less than a man; I lack common sense.

content: 3 I have not learned wisdom, Nor do I possess knowledge of the Holy One.
content_old: 3 I have not learned wisdom, Nor do I possess knowledge of the Holy One.

content: 4 Who has ascended heaven and come down? Who has gathered up the wind in the hollow of his hand? Who has wrapped the waters in his garment? Who has established all the extremities of the earth? What is his name or his son’s name, if you know it?
content_old: 4 Who has ascended heaven and come down? Who has gathered up the wind in the hollow of his hand? Who has wrapped the waters in his garment? Who has established all the extremities of the earth? What is his name or his son’s name, if you know it?

content: 5 Every word of God is pure, A shield to those who take refuge in Him.
content_old: 5 Every word of God is pure, A shield to those who take refuge in Him.

content: 6 Do not add to His words, Lest He indict you and you be proved a liar.
content_old: 6 Do not add to His words, Lest He indict you and you be proved a liar.

content: 7 Two things I ask of you; do not deny them to me before I die:
content_old: 7 Two things I ask of you; do not deny them to me before I die:

content: 8 Keep lies and false words far from me; Give me neither poverty nor riches, But provide me with my daily bread,
content_old: 8 Keep lies and false words far from me; Give me neither poverty nor riches, But provide me with my daily bread,

content: 9 Lest, being sated, I renounce, saying, “Who is the LORD?” Or, being impoverished, I take to theft And profane the name of my God.
content_old: 9 Lest, being sated, I renounce, saying, “Who is the LORD?” Or, being impoverished, I take to theft And profane the name of my God.

content: 10 Do not inform on a slave to his master, Lest he curse you and you incur guilt.
content_old: 10 Do not inform on a slave to his master, Lest he curse you and you incur guilt.

content: 11 There is a breed of men that brings a curse on its fathers And brings no blessing to its mothers,
content_old: 11 There is a breed of men that brings a curse on its fathers And brings no blessing to its mothers,

content: 12 A breed that thinks itself pure, Though it is not washed of its filth;
content_old: 12 A breed that thinks itself pure, Though it is not washed of its filth;

content: 13 A breed so haughty of bearing, so supercilious;
content_old: 13 A breed so haughty of bearing, so supercilious;

content: 14 A breed whose teeth are swords, Whose jaws are knives, Ready to devour the poor of the land, The needy among men.
content_old: 14 A breed whose teeth are swords, Whose jaws are knives, Ready to devour the poor of the land, The needy among men.

content: 15 The leech has two daughters, “Give!” and “Give!” Three things are insatiable; Four never say, “Enough!”:
content_old: 15 The leech has two daughters, “Give!” and “Give!” Three things are insatiable; Four never say, “Enough!”:

content: 16 Sheol, a barren womb, Earth that cannot get enough water, And fire which never says, “Enough!”
content_old: 16 Sheol, a barren womb, Earth that cannot get enough water, And fire which never says, “Enough!”

content: 17 The eye that mocks a father And disdains the homage due a mother— The ravens of the brook will gouge it out, Young eagles will devour it.
content_old: 17 The eye that mocks a father And disdains the homage due a mother— The ravens of the brook will gouge it out, Young eagles will devour it.

content: 18 Three things are beyond me; Four I cannot fathom:
content_old: 18 Three things are beyond me; Four I cannot fathom:

content: 19 How an eagle makes its way over the sky; How a snake makes its way over a rock; How a ship makes its way through the high seas; How a man has his way with a maiden.
content_old: 19 How an eagle makes its way over the sky; How a snake makes its way over a rock; How a ship makes its way through the high seas; How a man has his way with a maiden.

content: 20 Such is the way of an adulteress: She eats, wipes her mouth, And says, “I have done no wrong.”
content_old: 20 Such is the way of an adulteress: She eats, wipes her mouth, And says, “I have done no wrong.”

content: 21 The earth shudders at three things, At four which it cannot bear:
content_old: 21 The earth shudders at three things, At four which it cannot bear:

content: 22 A slave who becomes king; A scoundrel sated with food;
content_old: 22 A slave who becomes king; A scoundrel sated with food;

content: 23 A loathsome woman who gets married; A slave-girl who supplants her mistress.
content_old: 23 A loathsome woman who gets married; A slave-girl who supplants her mistress.

content: 24 Four are among the tiniest on earth, Yet they are the wisest of the wise:
content_old: 24 Four are among the tiniest on earth, Yet they are the wisest of the wise:

content: 25 Ants are a folk without power, Yet they prepare food for themselves in summer;
content_old: 25 Ants are a folk without power, Yet they prepare food for themselves in summer;

content: 26 The badger is a folk without strength, Yet it makes its home in the rock;
content_old: 26 The badger is a folk without strength, Yet it makes its home in the rock;

content: 27 The locusts have no king, Yet they all march forth in formation;
content_old: 27 The locusts have no king, Yet they all march forth in formation;

content: 28 You can catch the lizard in your hand, Yet it is found in royal palaces.
content_old: 28 You can catch the lizard in your hand, Yet it is found in royal palaces.

content: 29 There are three that are stately of stride, Four that carry themselves well:
content_old: 29 There are three that are stately of stride, Four that carry themselves well:

content: 30 The lion is mightiest among the beasts, And recoils before none;
content_old: 30 The lion is mightiest among the beasts, And recoils before none;

content: 31 The greyhound, the he-goat, The king whom none dares resist.
content_old: 31 The greyhound, the he-goat, The king whom none dares resist.

content: 32 If you have been scandalously arrogant, If you have been a schemer, Then clap your hand to your mouth.
content_old: 32 If you have been scandalously arrogant, If you have been a schemer, Then clap your hand to your mouth.

content: 1  The words of Lemuel, king of Massa, with which his mother admonished him:
content_old: 1  The words of Lemuel, king of Massa, with which his mother admonished him:

content: 2 No, my son! No, O son of my womb! No, O son of my vows!
content_old: 2 No, my son! No, O son of my womb! No, O son of my vows!

content: 3 Do not give your strength to women, Your vigor, to those who destroy kings.
content_old: 3 Do not give your strength to women, Your vigor, to those who destroy kings.

content: 4 Wine is not for kings, O Lemuel; Not for kings to drink, Nor any strong drink for princes,
content_old: 4 Wine is not for kings, O Lemuel; Not for kings to drink, Nor any strong drink for princes,

content: 5 Lest they drink and forget what has been ordained, And infringe on the rights of the poor.
content_old: 5 Lest they drink and forget what has been ordained, And infringe on the rights of the poor.

content: 6 Give strong drink to the hapless And wine to the embittered.
content_old: 6 Give strong drink to the hapless And wine to the embittered.

content: 7 Let them drink and forget their poverty, And put their troubles out of mind.
content_old: 7 Let them drink and forget their poverty, And put their troubles out of mind.

content: 8 Speak up for the dumb, For the rights of all the unfortunate.
content_old: 8 Speak up for the dumb, For the rights of all the unfortunate.

content: 9 Speak up, judge righteously, Champion the poor and the needy.
content_old: 9 Speak up, judge righteously, Champion the poor and the needy.

content: 10 What a rare find is a capable wife! Her worth is far beyond that of rubies.
content_old: 10 What a rare find is a capable wife! Her worth is far beyond that of rubies.

content: 11 Her husband puts his confidence in her, And lacks no good thing.
content_old: 11 Her husband puts his confidence in her, And lacks no good thing.

content: 12 She is good to him, never bad, All the days of her life.
content_old: 12 She is good to him, never bad, All the days of her life.

content: 13 She looks for wool and flax, And sets her hand to them with a will.
content_old: 13 She looks for wool and flax, And sets her hand to them with a will.

content: 14 She is like a merchant fleet, Bringing her food from afar.
content_old: 14 She is like a merchant fleet, Bringing her food from afar.

content: 15 She rises while it is still night, And supplies provisions for her household, The daily fare of her maids.
content_old: 15 She rises while it is still night, And supplies provisions for her household, The daily fare of her maids.

content: 16 She sets her mind on an estate and acquires it; She plants a vineyard by her own labors.
content_old: 16 She sets her mind on an estate and acquires it; She plants a vineyard by her own labors.

content: 17 She girds herself with strength, And performs her tasks with vigor.
content_old: 17 She girds herself with strength, And performs her tasks with vigor.

content: 18 She sees that her business thrives; Her lamp never goes out at night.
content_old: 18 She sees that her business thrives; Her lamp never goes out at night.

content: 19 She sets her hand to the distaff; Her fingers work the spindle.
content_old: 19 She sets her hand to the distaff; Her fingers work the spindle.

content: 20 She gives generously to the poor; Her hands are stretched out to the needy.
content_old: 20 She gives generously to the poor; Her hands are stretched out to the needy.

content: 21 She is not worried for her household because of snow, For her whole household is dressed in crimson.
content_old: 21 She is not worried for her household because of snow, For her whole household is dressed in crimson.

content: 22 She makes covers for herself; Her clothing is linen and purple.
content_old: 22 She makes covers for herself; Her clothing is linen and purple.

content: 23 Her husband is prominent in the gates, As he sits among the elders of the land.
content_old: 23 Her husband is prominent in the gates, As he sits among the elders of the land.

content: 24 She makes cloth and sells it, And offers a girdle to the merchant.
content_old: 24 She makes cloth and sells it, And offers a girdle to the merchant.

content: 25 She is clothed with strength and splendor; She looks to the future cheerfully.
content_old: 25 She is clothed with strength and splendor; She looks to the future cheerfully.

content: 26 Her mouth is full of wisdom, Her tongue with kindly teaching.
content_old: 26 Her mouth is full of wisdom, Her tongue with kindly teaching.

content: 27 She oversees the activities of her household And never eats the bread of idleness.
content_old: 27 She oversees the activities of her household And never eats the bread of idleness.

content: 28 Her children declare her happy; Her husband praises her,
content_old: 28 Her children declare her happy; Her husband praises her,

content: 29 “Many women have done well, But you surpass them all.”
content_old: 29 “Many women have done well, But you surpass them all.”

content: 30 Grace is deceptive, Beauty is illusory; It is for her fear of the LORD That a woman is to be praised.
content_old: 30 Grace is deceptive, Beauty is illusory; It is for her fear of the LORD That a woman is to be praised.
